Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: VSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was utterly charming! From the incredibly helpful, friendly, accomodating staff, to the lovely reception area and old world bedrooms, I can't recommend it highly enough. Location wise, it is also ideal. Right in the middle of the vibrant left bank, close to the metro and a short walk to the Paris sights. A great choice for visitors to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: Our first stay in Paris and we couldn't have picked a better place. The room was clean and comfortable. The service was very helpful. One night we came in late with pastries and I was hoping to get some milk (can you tell I'm from the States?) and the man on duty went into the closed kitchen and brought back a glass for me. I had heard Paris could be rather unfriendly, but this never turned out to be true for us. The staff at the Left Bank were wonderful. Also, there are some very good restaurants nearby and the Metro as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nicely presented but air-con didn't work”
Reviews.Author: MrFBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here recently (March 2012) and chose this hotel because it looked very nice and was in a very central location. Arriving in Paris via Eurostar we simply caught one metro line from Gare du Nord down to Odeon and after a 2 minute walk we arrived at the hotel. It was as nice as it looked on their website. Our standard room on the 1st floor was nicely presented, small (aren't they all in Paris?) but not too small and had a nice bathroom. However, our room was hot and the air conditioning console in the room didn't seem to work. We raised this issue with two different staff members and neither fixed the problem (they were friendly enough...just didn't fix the issue). We couldn't open the windows at night because the street below was noisy (with the windows shut it was very quiet) so had two rather stuffy nights in our room. It wasn't unbearable, just slightly uncomfortable. Anyway, on the positive side they have posted my partner's necklace back free of charge (we carelessly left it behind) - apparently French customs are strict so we should be thankful. So, positives = great location, nice welcoming staff, nice room, clean, nice breakfast (don't bother going out searching for a better deal at a cafe) Negatives = not cheap (but Paris is an expensive city), hot room (but don't let us put you off)

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here, You'll Love It”
Reviews.Author: DaveRoberts
Reviews.Content: A charming small Left Bank hotel! You can experience a classic Left Bank building with exposed beams and original walls. But with modern conveniences such as bathrooms and free wi-fi that's actually fast. The location is just blocks from the Seine and all that you want to visit, and it's next door to Procope, one of the oldest restaurants in Paris. Plan several meals there--the food and service are great, prices are reasonable, and they have a menu in English. But what you'll like most about your stay is the remarkable people who work the desk. In a small hotel, the desk person is everything--hotel manager, concierge, reservationist, money changer, greeter. The Left Bank desk people will make your reservations, give you advice, help you in any way. They are very capable and always friendly. My wife and I stayed here 25 years ago, decided to stay here again on this trip. We recalled aspects of our previous wonderful visit, but enjoyed this one even more. I recommend this hotel if you'd like to start your own memories of wonderful Paris visits!

Reviews.Title: “At The Center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: deltlover
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris was made all the better by this hotel, its tremendous staff and the very best location possible. The rooms are of a decent size, the included breakfasts are ample, the staff very friendly and helpful. All of this is good but what is great is the location. You are right by three must see and visit cafes (Le Deux Magots, Cafe de Flore and Brasserie Lipp), the metro, cabs and within walking distance of most of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational, Atmospheric Hotel”
Reviews.Author: phillipislandfamily
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of being a guest at this wonderful hotel twice and would add that in my opinion is by far the best hotel i have stayed in anywhere . From the reception staff to the wonderful management you are treated extremely well. Efficient and knowledgable, the staff bend over backwards to assist you. The atmosphere of this period hotel is amazing with it wonderful furnishings, and the way the hotel has been lovingly restored and cared makes the placeooze with character . The superior rooms have the very best linen and furnishings ,with comfy large beds and great classical french windows together with flower boxes make the place a joy to stay in . The bathroom are also beautifully decorated with classical tap fittings and great deep bath with fluffy towels.and french toiletries.Breakfast is a feast with a wonderful french buffet, cheeses and fruits goumet jams and baguettes , very generous and satisfying . Original tapestrys adorn walls together with charming antiques make the hotel so adorable Really love this hotel and the bonus is its location on the Left Bank ina picturesque small street close to gret eateries and bars and all great small boutiques as well . This is the hotel for me Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service and Essence of Paris Views”
Reviews.Author: Kristine43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel two other times. Each time had exceptional service. This is what I mean. The first time I traveled to Paris, I was alone and was robbed late Saturday afternoon (when all banks and post offices were closed) before I was scheduled to leave the following day. The hotel front desk clerk LOANED ME 100 Euros for food and taxi to get to the airport. Unbelievable! Since I felt I was still getting my bearings when I made the second trip to Paris, I stayed with my friends at Left Bank--St Germain again. I LOVE the location--near Odeon Metro, near Seine, near Louvre, so close to everything. I especially enjoyed opening my window onto the street late one Friday night in May, seeing the couples walking arm-in-arm up and down the sidewalk. And this may seem silly, but I love the name of the street--Rue De L'Ancienne Comedie. So, for all of the above reasons, when my husband and I decided to honeymoon in Paris, I chose MY hotel again, but this time, we booked the suite. Imagine a December dusk in Paris, temperatures in the upper forties. From one side of the suite we can see the Eiffel Tower; the opposite side we have our window open--cool, fresh air. We have a clear view of Notre Dame, but even more wonderful, we can hear the Notre Dame bells chiming across the city. I will never forget that moment. From our hotel window on New Year's Eve, we could see all the fireworks and lights at the Eiffel Tower celebration while we comfortably toasted in our room and had our first kiss in the new year. Have to mention Sinan--the hotel desk clerk. What a wonderful young man. So helpful to us in every way. This is MY hotel. I'm not sure it will ever be possible for me to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the BEST Location”
Reviews.Author: Mary-anne F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Paris at Hotel Left Bank for a week. It is the first time we have visited Paris and I had researched many hotels in many locations before we left. For first time visitors who wanted to be close to attractions, cafes, shops and metro stations we found St Germain Des Pres to be the best location and Hotel Left Bank the best hotel option. We were really impressed with our hotel room. It was small and cosy with a lovely bathroom including a bath. It looked exactly as the picture on the web site showed (which doesn't always happen). We arrived on a very chilly Paris day to find a beautifully warm room with a very comfortable bed, the staff had put the towel warmer so we had toasty warm towels ready for us - much appreciated after a 30 hour flight from Australia! The area of St Germain des pres is a wonderful, safe area full of cafes, small specialty shops and galleries. It was a real treat to wander through its little streets during the day, but what really suprised us is how the streets come alive in the evening. The atmosphere nearly every night of the week was really exciting and fun. We always felt really safe walking the streets in the evening and using the metro was safe, easy and inexpensive. The hotel is in walking distance from Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg, Louvre, Seine River and if you're keen for a big walk or jog, the eiffel tower. There are so many cafes around the Hotel Left Bank, we had breakfast in a different cafe everyday for the 8 days of our stay, they were all lovely, staff friendly, nice and so helpful with the language (most people were more than happy to speak to us in English even though I could speak a little French). If I was ever lucky enough to go back to Paris I would absolutely stay at Hotel Left Bank again - thank you to all the staff, we had a perfect stay! PS: Make sure you eat a crepe with Nutella and Banana from the little takeaway shop 3-4 doors up. They are the best in Paris - trust me, I know!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: fussypants7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Valentines week for our first trip to Paris. This is a great neighborhood with lots of places to eat and shop very close. Also, many of the tourists sights are walking distance too. The staff was nice and offered suggestions on places to eat. The only complaint we had was the beds were not very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mamaducky
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay at Hotel Left Bank. The hotel is in a wonderful Left Bank location, close to restaurants and shopping. Our room for four was great for a family. The breakfast was very nice. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Actually, the professionalism of the staff was one of the high points of our visit. One little note, if you are traveling with a person with mobility issues make sure to ask where your room is located in the hotel and if you will need to use any stairs to access it. My son uses a wheelchair part time and our room was in an older part of the hotel. There is an elevator but we still needed to go up a few stairs to get into our room. It wasn't a problem for us, but do keep that in mind when making your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Adamus76
Reviews.Content: Booking a hotel in Paris is always risky - it's an expensive city and the price of a room is no guarantee of quality. We struck gold with the Left Bank hotel though. Not only is it very easily found, very close to the Odeon metro station, it is also very nice. The twin room we had was small but by Parisian standards quite spacious with a lovely bathroom. Despite looking out on a busy street the room was very quiet and we slept wonderfully well. The reception staff was invariably friendly and helpful. One thing I would recommend is to skip the hotel's own breakfast - while it's perfectly acceptable, there are better breakfasts to be had in very close proximity to the hotel at various brasseries.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NanaZylber
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have stood at this hotel in september 2011 and we loved it. We know some 2 or 3 stars hotels in Paris and Left bank was a good surprise. Small but functional bedroom. Very quiet, even on the first floor, thanks to the good sound isolation. Very confortable bed. Free wi fi.Tiny but nice bathroom, very clean, with bathtub and shower. Good bath products. Near to the famous Le Procope restaurant. Friendly staff. The location is great. You have to carry your luggage to the room in a small lift, but it's normal in Europe, mostly in budget hotels. The buffet breakfast was excelent. The price is ok if you get a promotional rate - the normal rate is about 300-350 euro for a double room. But you manage to get a room for less than 200 euro. We would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: azinuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to many attractions. Our room was quiet and clean. If you are looking for a solid 3 star hotel, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy Hotel in the Heart of St-Germain des Prés-”
Reviews.Author: Ekika06
Reviews.Content: A small but lovely hotel- the rooms are confortable and well decorated with "Toile de Jouy " on the walls-prices are not expensive and the situation right in St Germain wonderful- lots of nice Bistro - restaurants very near- It is very lifely and you can walk around without any problems ;;; Not far from "Les Quais de la Seine"- Notre Dame - La Sainte Chapelle - just cross the bridges to go to the "Rive Doirte" where is the Musée du Louvre- Les Tuileries- La Place de la Concorde!!! At the Hotel the service is good- At the reception desk the Hostess is very kind and helpful- The Breakfast (small buffet with croissants and pains au chocolat)is included in the rate- I have known this Hotel for many years and each time I stay in Paris I go to "The Left Bank "

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient accomodation, nice design, friendly service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Irkutsk22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 days in the beginning of January, and can definitely recommend it for both furst-time and experienced visitors of Paris. It is in the middle of a nice safe neighbourghood within minutes walking distance to many sights, with a variety of restaurants around the place, several movie thetres with films in English, and with excellent transport connections. I liked the decor and condition of the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, espacially the breakfast lady. The only (small) disappointment was when at late night check-in, when instead of twin bedding (which was booked and confirmed) we found one bed. This was changed the next day, but at the time of check in the man at the front desk refused to acknowledge the difference between twin and double bed, which was a bit annoying. However, positive experience of the following days left a pleasant impression. Do stay at the hotel, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Clare A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights recently and I must say I was very surprised about the great location. The surroundings were pleasant, and it is within 5 minutes to Notre Dame, and 10 minutes to the Louvre. The service was excellent, and the breakfasts were surprisingly enjoyable. I loved the coffee, and the chocolate-filled pastry was delightful. My room was exactly what I needed, reasonable size, a comfortable bed, and a great-sized bathroom with everything you need. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a greatly located hotel with excellent service. Five stars!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: artandshoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days here in July 2011. The minor things I hear people complain about, well, those are the things we found charming, different, memorable or worthy of a laugh or a smile! The small elevator meant only 2 out of 3 of us could use it at one time. This is not a big deal people. The room was small, but actually was BIGGER than I had envisioned after reading about 'small Paris hotel rooms'. Our bathroom was modern and had double sinks. Shower (no curtain and tempermental spout) was a challenge the first time it was used, but not hard to adjust to. Our shampoo/soap supply wasnt replenished as often as a North American hotel would do, but I think you can ask at the front desk for more if you were desperate. The complimentary breakfast was one our favourite parts of each day! The coffee especially good, pain au chocolat and croissantes we loved, yogurts, fruit, jams ... it was plenty as far as we were concerned. We loved the woman who served the coffee, and it didnt take her long to automatically know who to bring coffee/tea/hot water to each morning :) * I see that it will soon cost you extra for the breakfast (it was included when we were there). Perhaps try it the first day, and decide if its worth the extra money. Monsieur Sinan at the front desk is the gem of the hotel! He was friendly, helpful, educational and always funny! We loved him too. Room decor/general hotel decor is old world and delightful. Have an open mind. You're in a different land, vive les differences! Location is perfect perfect perfect. Metro so close, and many major sites within quick walks. One of my favourite parts of the day was after breakfast, I'd go outside to have a smoke and watch early morning Paris go by. I'd always see such neat things happening and interesting people walking or driving by. Safety: We felt safe in both the neighbourhood and the hotel. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: FashAsh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very old building and when you walk in it looks very french. This does not have the sterile impersonal feeling that you're expecting from a hotel with the name "Best Western". Everyone who works the counter speaks English and they are extremely nice and helpful. We were upgraded upon arrival to a suite, which in Paris is still very small. But as long as you're not surprised by the size of the rooms, it's fine. The hotel is in a really cool neighborhood with lots of shops, bakeries, and restaurants. It's close to the metro and walking distance to the RER. It's also just a short walk to Sainte Chappel and Notre Dame. The included continental breakfast was a treat - but be warned - after 1/1/2012 it's going to cost 12 Euros per person. There is a bakery right across the street and several other bakeries and cafes nearby to choose from so it might be worth the effort to head out for breakfast. My only complaint is that they could definitely use an upgrade on their mattresses and pillows, but overall I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A warm, friendly hotel which is well located”
Reviews.Author: C C C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice during our recent Europe trip. We felt very welcome both times we were there. The staff are friendly and helpful, especially Sinan who handled our check-ins on both occasions. We were given a city map showing our location and also information on points of interest, eating places and other amenities in the surrounding area. In the room, we were given an electric kettle so we can make our own tea/coffee. Sinan even helped us secure last-minute tickets for a concert.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, in great location; overall couldn't have asked for better and would definitely recommend highly.”
Reviews.Author: Edwardbostock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazingly located very close to the Odeon metro station and easy to walk to other stations and some tourist attractions (e.g. Notre Dame). Also plenty of well priced restaurants with good food (we had 3 courses for €12.50 per person). Room was a decent size for Paris, very clean and bathroom good - shower excellent. Lift was being refurbished so the walk to 5th floor not ideal but the complimentary breakfast more than made up for it. All in all would definitely go back and will be recommending to any friends or family who are travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, ambiance and service!”
Reviews.Author: Brad N
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Left Bank and will definitely stay there again if we go back to Paris! The hotel staff was friendly and extremely helpful, with very quick responses to my questions (via e-mails) and arranging an airport shuttle before our trip to helping us with city tours and restaurants once we arrived. They also spoke good English. I don’t know how many rooms it has, but it has the feel of a small, quaint European hotel on a smaller, but lively side street just a block off the bustling St. Germain Blvd (we were on the back side so did not hear any street traffic at night). Our room (a suite) was very clean and classically decorated to match the classic European flavor (note: rooms in a typical European city hotel are going to be smaller than comparative American hotels). The bathroom was also very nice and clean and probably considered spacious by European standards. Continental breakfast was typical, but met our needs. The hotel was in a perfect location with cafes, bars, take-out shops, and nice restaurants all within 1-2 blocks (recommend the quaint Vins et Terroirs, just around the corner for nice French dinner at relatively reasonable price). Metro and RER trains were 5-10 min walks at most, but we didn't use them much as we walked most everywhere (to Notre Dame, the Musee de Orsay and the Louve, which were all 15-20 minute walks). We used the metro for the Eiffel Tower and Arch de Triumph. Overall, the hotel’s location, ambiance and service made our trip to Paris very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay...”
Reviews.Author: sebastian_blaj
Reviews.Content: Typically small rooms, quite decent and clean. "Continental breakfast" - a joke! Also typical for France. One morning they were out of baguettes, so that an employee was sent around the corner to buy some... Friendly personell, best location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: NycMeredith
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel with our 12 year old granddaughter sharing our room. It was definitely a stretch to think 3 people could fit in this tiny room, but we managed. Then, the bill was much more than we thought we had agreed to when booking the hotel on line. We were told it was for the extra bed, but we thought that was included in the original price on line. Having said that the pluses were: location, location, location. This hotel could not be better located in my opinion. Also, the staff were lovely and helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast accommodated all tastes and needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KGG22
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 recently stayed here and had a great stay. We chose the hotel based on reviews here on tripadvisor and were not disappointed - the location is worth the stay alone. Your are less than a block to a metro station and there are plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars and shopping within minutes. There is even a little grocery store nearby to stock up on essentials for your room. There is a very nice boulangerie across the street as well as place to get wine. Our room looked into the courtyard so it was very quiet. The only negative is that people would sneak a cigarette through their window in the courtyard and the smell would come into our room if the window was open. I believe the hotel is non smoking. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel very quiet so we all slept very well. Breakfast was continental and met our needs very nicely. The coffee was decent and the kids were able to have hot chocolate which they loved. I would recommend this hotel and we would without hesitation stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, location, value”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneK2011
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a weekend in Paris based on other reviews and I was not disappointed. As a young couple, we are on a bit of a budget, but found this room to be reasonably priced for the location (right off St. Germain and within minutes of major sightseeing). Upon arrival we were upgraded to a large room with a king size bed and full bathroom. The hotel itself has a charming decor and was very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was included in our room price, but it wasn't anything to rave about, just an added convenience with the bare essentials. The staff, however, was extremely friendly and helpful. They also booked us a shuttle to and from the airport, which I found to be much better than hauling luggage on the trains and fairly similar in price. My only negative comment was that at times we could hear people in the room next door, but it was a family with children and most of the noise occurred between the walls in the bathroom. The location was absolutely perfect and provided easy access to the Seine, the Louve, Notre Dame, St. Germain (lively street) and major metro and tube lines just around the corner. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, New World Comfort”
Reviews.Author: hollyljohnson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a recent week in Paris and were charmed by this wooden-beamed ceiling hotel. We were able to sleep well in a first story room facing the street thanks to double glazed windows, heavy curtains and a comfy bed. The breakfast was good, the hotel staff friendly and helpful, and the location unbeatable for exploring Paris. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Carolise G
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this charming little hotel. Location was fantastic! Walked to everything - a lovely walk to the Seine and across the many bridges to both Notre Dame and The Louvre, where we spent a lovely day. If you dont like to walk far, the metro is just at the end of the street and just 10 minutes to the Champs Elysee or Eiffel Tower. Breakfast is included in the the room rate and we thought it was perfect - a fresh basket of french bread and croissants, along with some sweet pastries. There was cereal, bread for toasting, cold meats and cheese, fruit juice and coffee served fresh just the way you like it. This neighbourhood is crammed with restaurants and bars and the lively Boulevards St Michel and St Germain right round the corner for shopping and people watching. We ate locally every night - the first magical night in the Rue de Buci at the Cafe de Paris, where we waited a little while for a lovely table outside and enjoyed excellent service and affrordable good food (not to mention the pichet du vin). Our room was an 'inside' room with no view of the street. it was beautifully quiet and, on opening the window, looked out at a small courtyard where the walls had been treated to a 'faux finish' giving a a wonderful effect of golden sunshine and vines growing. The room was small but so prettily decorated and cosy and immaculately clean. The Bathroom was modern and the shower hot and powerful. There was a large closet, which meant we could unpack and stow our cases. Front desk staff were always extremely helpful and friendly. They gave us an adaptor for our laptop and key for the safe when we arrived. Unfortunately, we then found the computer would not fit in the safe!!! A shuttle service was arranged for us to the airport by Front desk staff and was very reasonable and turned up right on time. We cannot wait to go back to this lovely hotel and are already planning our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: SwimmingGnome
Reviews.Content: This is a great neighborhood but there are many other hotels in the neighborhood for less that are equal or better. The room was extremely small with no natural light. Breakfast and common areas were cramped. Food, so not special. Front desk help was not helpful. There is an airport shuttle however for 20 Euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Msm956
Reviews.Content: Great staff who are very helpful and the hotel is in an excellent location. Rooms are small for the price. Just walking around the area there seemed to be a number of similar hotels within a couple of blocks with rooms for about 50 Euro less (225 Euro). Many had larger lobby's with better seating. I thought by paying a little more for the Left Bank Hotel the rooms would have been a little larger and the lobby nicer. Very clean and well maintained. Airport shuttle service was great and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous decor”
Reviews.Author: Torvie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful introduction to the delights of Paris and the sophistication of the people. We had a triple room which had adequate space and all the comfort we needed for 3 nights. Our room's windows (304) faced the courtyard which meant we had minimal street noise. The breakfast was good and the catering staff helpful. The decoration and comfort of our room provided a welcome respite from sightseeing and feasting. Left Bank provides a level of service and comfort above what I would expect from a 3* hotel. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet and yet many things are in walking distance. The persons at the front desk are very helpful. The rooms are big and nicely furnished. Everything is just excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Name says it all”
Reviews.Author: Captainaubrey
Reviews.Content: Quintessential left bank experience. Small well run hotel with intelligent and helpful front desk. Nice rooms, which would have been improved by duvets and better pillows. Bang in the middle of a warren of small streets with great restaurants, and a lovely atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: margaret r
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over a weekend in a family room. My husband and I have both been to Paris before, albeit many years ago, and had prepared the kids to not get too excited about the accommodation. Wow, what a pleasant surprise. Our first contact was the woman on the front desk who was so pleasant and helped with many of our questions. The hotel itself is in a building that dates back to 16th century - for us this is a WOW on its own. We just loved the hotel and room and its character- very clean, comfortable and quiet with an elegant bathroom. The room had air conditioning which might be useful in mid summer - though we were there during a autumn heatwave and the room was cool. The hotels location is absolutely the best - 15min walk to Notre Dame and The Louvre, around the corner from the Odeon Metro, cafes/bistros/art galleries galore. We also had breakfast included - Le petit dejeuner that also had cereals for those not wanting the traditional European start.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: BasicLinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect choice in several ways. It is located in an area loaded with restaurants, cafes and brasseries, there is a full grocery store just around the corner and the Odeon metro stop is only one block away. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and it was just so convenient for a very enjoyable trip to Paris. It also provides a full breakfast, including eggs, meats, cheeses, juices, baked goods, fruit, yogurt in the price of the room which is very hard to find in Paris. The coffee was fresh and hot and good. If you ask at the reception desk they will give you a kettle and cups to make coffee or tea in your room. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: scrappyCincinnati
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel and by reserving early you can get a good rate. The room was quiet and the air conditioning worked. (always a plus in Paris). The breakfast was uninspired but adequate. The concierge did a good job of reserving car transport to airport, dinner reservations. And the location is absolutely great. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of it all.”
Reviews.Author: georgiamama50
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 small children ages 5 & 6) just returned from a five night stay at the Hotel Left Bank. We had found this hotel because they allowed occupancy of four. The room was plenty roomy, as well as the bath. Just one word of advice before you go. Pack your own hair dryer. They have one in the bathroom but it does not do the trick. The breakfast was wonderful especially when travelling with children. I had read many reviews before we went and all of my high expectations were met except for really one. The front desk staff was really not as friendly or as helpful as I had hoped. We had the occasion to ask for help a couple of times and I wish I could say that they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dlucido
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything, shops, cafes, attractions. The people were very friendly, the breakfast was good, the rooms were very nice. We traveled here with our adult sons and they loved it because they could walk everywhere. The only complaint I had was that I wanted to print my boarding pass the night before and there is no access to a printer in the lobby. I tried to get the night reception person to print it but he did not understand English well so he did not help me. The gentleman that was on during the day was extremely helpful and always friendly. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: loveeurope1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely great....would recommend it to everyone. The receptionists are wonderful and helpful...location is fabulous for seeing the area and close to all. Cool for cafes and having a nice walk in evening to louve.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel - great service, facility just okay”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Seaweed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my wife back in April. Location was great, although the streets can be a bit confusing at first. Only real complaint was that the room was sooo small, bed was small and bathroom was small. We're not typically large Americans, so I'm writing this with large people in m ind. Full sized bed was barely big enough for the two of us. Bathroom was small and toilet area was tiny. I'm not wide and I can't imagine how a "wide person" would even be able to use the facility. Breakfast in the morning was different - cold foods, cereal, bread, ham, hard boiled eggs, cheese, juice, coffee. Worked for us. The woman behind the front desk was extremely helpful explaining the different tours available and when we decided to venture into the Metro, she gave us excellent directions. Paris has so much to offer, it's a bit tough to see and do it all over a 4-day weekend. Which is fine by me, since we now have a reason to go back. We had great difficulty with the different dining options - never really had a great dinner. Did lunches that were okay and ended up eating crepes on the street to get through the eve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FABERRIMAN
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, very clean and very polite and friendly staff; would defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Got an awesome last-minute deal on a suite, had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: data_wrangler_nyc
Reviews.Content: After I had huge problems with another hotel in Paris, my friend and I needed a last-minute room for one night, and the Left Bank St. Germain gave us a great rate on a Suite at the last minute. The room was big and clean and had a great view; some of the furniture was a little worn-in, but didn't affect the quality of our stay. The breakfast in the morning was huge and awesome, best of any of the hotel breakfasts I had.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: hauoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BW Left Bank with my college-age daughter at the end of May. Location was great. The travel agent that made our other reservations through France and Italy wanted us to stay on the Right Bank at a place right behind the Ritz. A friend insisted that the Left Bank was the place to be. And he was right. There were so many places to eat in the area around the BW Left Bank...and maybe best of all is the Eric Kayser Boulangerie right across the street...fabulous...the usual suspects of course...the bread and the sweets, but the tea was great and the quiche! It was easy for my daughter to get over to Luxemburg Gardens for jogging some mornings...easy access to great shopping, the Seine, Notre Dame, Lourve, other galleries - a cab to the Eiffel Tower (so fun), and Champs des Elysees - no problem. As for the hotel...it was the most humble of every other place we stayed, but I felt good about the savings - the room was quite generous in size for Paris, actually had a third single bed on the way to the bath, that we used as a couch/living room...it had a very high headboard the helped create privacy for my daughter's many strange-timed calls (via Skype) to her boyfriend in Calif. Thermostat efficient, the linens and all that so-so, but it was clean...and there were two sinks in the bath! Front desk, more than adequate - mostly friendly, always helpful - leaving and arriving just fine...breakfast o.k....(do think, on another Europe trip with a verrry early morning arrival, it would be great to have room reserved for night before just to be able to shower and all upon arrival...could be tempting the flying gods as to keeping to a schedule...but worth a thought).

Reviews.Title: “Over and above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: FLei
Reviews.Content: The Best Wester Premier Left Bank in St. Germain went over and above our expectations. My husband and I and our two sons just returned from Paris . With all I had heard about 3 star European hotels I was not sure what to expect. This hotel was perfect. My husband and I shared a superior 3 bed room(two twin beds together and a daybed) and my boys were in a superior twin(two twin beds). Our room had a double sink and marble bathroom and the rooms were spacious. Our sons were across the hall and we felt like we had our own suite. The air conditioning worked great and although we did have non-smoking rooms, we did not smell smoke from any of the other rooms. The rooms were kept clean, were very quiet, and replenished with towels and soaps, etc, daily. The breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, pastries, yogurts, fruit, juice and coffee. The woman who served the breakfast from 7am to 11am even came in earlier to prepare breakfast for my husband and sons one day to take on a very early trip to Normandy. The entire staff was helpful and friendly and the Left Bank was a great and fun place to stay. I relied on trip advisor for booking this hotel so I wanted to make sure I reported that absolutely all the positive reviews are true. Will definitely stay at this hotel if we return to Paris. Oh, and free wifi throughout the hotel. Even in the rooms, which did cut out from time to time, but enough to check emails and have wifi. Our 4 star hotel did not!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, congenial staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bikesvirginia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for a few days each summer several years in a row. The hotel is very charming, small, friendly, personable. It is right smack in the middle of the most interesting area of the Left Bank-flanked by cafes, bistros, movie theatres. We love the location and the friendliness of the hotel staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “lived up to it's reviews”
Reviews.Author: MAT900XLT
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as expected after reading the reviews. A better than average French breakfast. The room was smallish but well furnished with a large clean bathroom. There was no problem with noise with the windows closed and the room was air conditioned The position of the hotel in the St. Germain district was within 100m of the Metro and the mass of bars and restaurants, and a short walk to the Seine. Next to the hotel is the excellent ' le Procope ' restaurant, one of the oldest in Paris, and the food was up to a high standard, albeit not inexpensive. Would not hesitate in recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: MNnortherner
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in the ground floor quad, just down the hall off the lobby, for three nights. When we arrived in the morning, the room was not ready, so we placed our luggaged in the storage closet and started wandering the wonderful St. Germain neighborhood. You definitely pay for the location -- it is not a cheap date, but Paris is not a cheap city. The inclusion of a full breakfast adds significant value, particularly for families, as you can start the day with delicious breads, jams, honey, meats and cheeses, hard-boiled eggs, juices and fruits, and yogurt. Definitely enough to tie you over until lunch (or as we did, until dinner, with a light snack mid-day instead). The breakfast room is very pleasant, as is the public lobby area. The room is advertised as a quad but really is a triple with cot (albeit a comfortable one with regular twin mattress) added in between the other beds already in the room. Essentially you have a row of beds, with little other space in the main bedroom area, but then a very spacious bathroom (perhaps one of our teens should have slept in there?!). The bathroom was nicely appointed with above-average soaps and gels. We found the free wi-fi to be non-existent or unreliable in our room, and typically would have to go to the lobby to use it and maintain a signal. As noted by many others, as well, the location is just great. You walk out the door and next door is the classic restaurant Le Procope (we ate there the last evening approaching midnight, and I really enjoyed their coq au vin, while my son adventured out a bit with the calf's head which I can't say I'd recommend.) There are shops and cafes galore in every direction, a wonderful vibe day and night. We walked virtually everywhere, to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Orsay, the Orangerie . . . we did have a cab drop us at the Place de la Concorde the evening we wanted to walk the Champs Elysees and then meander over to the Eiffel Tower for our 9:30 tickets (a wonderful time to ascend in the summer!). The Odeon and St. Michel train/metro stations are close by, which made traveling to Versailles very convenient. We asked the front desk to arrange for our cab back to the airport the morning we departed, and the taxi was waiting as scheduled. The front desk personnel were pleasant and helpful. Overall, the hotel was quiet and we all experienced a very comfortable stay and good nights' rests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Nice Hotel, Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: Tenr2th
Reviews.Content: One of the most difficult things we came across in planning our vacation in Europe was finding rooms that would suit the four of us (2 adults, a 16 and 11 year old). We can make do, but the kids want their own bed, understandably. After searching through hundreds of hotels, we narrowed it down to this one, and were very pleased with the result. Upon our arrival, the room was ready (Queen and two singles, even though one single was a foldout, it was adequate and comfortable for the little one). The rooms are not large, but they were clean, comfortably appointed and very quiet. The air conditioning was also excellent. Bathrooms a little small, not the strongest shower,but overall, they worked and we had no problems with anything. Continental breakfast plus some hard boiled eggs and meats were very good. Fresh hot coffee or tea was readily available at anytime. Front desk staff were extremely friendly, kind and helpful to all our needs (arranging taxi, restaurant suggestions, etc.) The bill was accurate. The location of the hotel was convenient to walking to the Louvre and Notre Dame. Paris is a very walkable city and we accomplished most of our means of getting around that way. Wear comfortable shoes. Just a few blocks from the Seine for a lovely walk. Also very close to RER stop (for Versailles) and Metro. Restaurants abounding in this area. If we were to return to Paris we would stay there again. I'm a pretty hard grader, and would have given it a 5 if it was more "full service" vs. being a bed and breakfast (basically). It all depends on your needs, but for our family, this worked out exceptionally well and we were very pleased with this hotel. Trip Advisor provides a valuable service in helping one select accomodations, especially when you're doing this on your own far from home. You never know what you're going to find but the collective opinions of others make this task a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Chessie3
Reviews.Content: Great spot for sightseeing. Reasonably priced, very nice breakfast included,.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Left bank hotel with excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJ24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, and the room was very comfortable. The staff were courteous and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. The location is very convenient for tourists. There was some noise from the elevator, but that is hard to avoid in smaller Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris several times and this really is the best,a fabulous location. Only 5 minutes from a choice of metro stations and a short walk to the Seine and Notre Dame or Luxemburg Gardens. The choice of eating in the area is also excellent. The hotel is on a fairly busy side street and we had a room facing it but were never bothered by street noise. The rooms are typical Parisian small with a double bed however they were nicely decorated in an old world style. Rooms have a safe which is vital in Paris ( get the key from reception). Breakfast is in a rather small room so you could be unlucky with seats if busy but we were always fine. Bread basket provided rather than help yourself but adequate selection of chees & meats etc. We booked direct on the hotels web site, they take first night as a deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kclynch
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location for exploring Paris. Right on the edge of the Latin Quarter with tons of cafes to choose from. Much different feel from the last time we visited in 1995 and stayed on the right bank near the Louvre. You really get the atmosphere we expected from our visit staying in this part of town. Hotel is a plain brown wrapper on the outside and uses their small space inside well. We were in a 1st floor Quad room that was perfect. Large bathroom with 4 single beds, pretty basic but then we were not there for the room. Can someone explain why French hotels don't provide show curtains or doors? Does all of Europe still only take baths? Not really a complaint but it seems obvious thing to provide. Also, bring your american wash cloths too...... Love the free Internet!

Reviews.Title: “A good location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mdtravelers10
Reviews.Content: We found the Left Bank a good choice for a short visit to Paris. It is located in an area filled with restaurants and not far from the metro. The hotel is pretty inside and the room, although small like rooms in Paris often are, was comfortable. Even though there is some street noise, the air conditioning allowed us to close the windows for sleeping, and the room was quiet. The breakfast was good, with more than enough choice. We were glad to have the WiFi available. Our only problem with our stay at the hotel was that the taxi that we had asked to be ordered for our early morning trip to the airport failed to show up. It was not clear why that occurred, but it was only by luck that we were able to flag down a taxi down at the corner in time to make the plane. Otherwise, the staff were helpful with recommending restaurants (particularly on the Rue Christine nearby) and they were pleasant. Overall, we found this a good choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family experience”
Reviews.Author: grandfalloon
Reviews.Content: After spending 4 nights in a very large London hotel, we stayed for 4 nights in a room for 4 - one of the few that I could find in paris. I think the hotel gave us a great "Paris" environment - it was small yet reasonably comfortable, quaint, and in an absolutely fantastic location. The breakfast was fine and consisted of a basket of pastries; a couple of meats (2) and cheeses (4 or 5); hard boiled eggs; canned fruit; and beverages. (Fresh fruit would have been nice.) We arrived late on June 21 - the summer solstice and annual music festival. Getting to the hotel was like driving thru the last parade of Mardi Gras. I was very concerned that we would never get to sleep. Once in the room, we couldn't hear a thing. The location is fanstastic. The hotel is on a small side street with numerous shops and restaurants within a 3 minute walk. The metro serving two lines is about a minute away. Pont Neuf is less than a 5 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: beyondspace
Reviews.Content: I found the service at the hotel to be excellent. I needed something at 2 in the morning and there it was! The room was a reasonable size for one person; very good lighting and the bathroom was modern. I especially liked the towerl warmer! The temperature control worked very well (and was quiet) and the room was always at the temperature that I desired. The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter and is very well situated for walks and exploring of Paris. I would return to the Hotel Left Bank-St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and we would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: fstkst
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, no language problems, nice rooms, great continental breakfast. One of the best locations in Paris - close (walking distance) to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, St. Chapelle and other sites. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: diastolic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and quiet and staff was helpful. Located near the Odeon metro and a couple of other metros.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable triple room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Elvtars
Reviews.Content: We had difficulties finding a hotel room for three in central Paris. Standard rooms looked tiny for the supplementary beds offered and suites were expensive. When we finally found what we needed, it was a triple room in Hotel Left Bank. Larger than a standard room, it had a comfortable, full-sized third bed in a separate area. Nicely decorated, it reminded us of the interior of renaissance châteaux. The bathroom was also large by Paris standards, offering a double vanity and a full-size bathtub with shower. Everything looked recently renovated and was in perfect working condition, except the elevator, which broke down twice in five days. We found a non-refundable deal for this room on booking.com and the hotel tried to charge our credit card immediately. Unfortunately, the fraud detection system at the credit card company considered this transaction suspicious and denied it. The hotel then emailed us asking for another card, but never tried to use it, instead a few days later notified us that it has cancelled our reservation. It took several phone calls to booking.com, the hotel, and the credit card company to finally sort things out. If I came across a similar deal again, I’d definitely call the credit card company first. The hotel has a great location, at a short walking distance to the river Seine, Place Saint-Michel, Ile-de-la-Cité, Notre-Dame, Saint-Chapel, Boulevard Saint-Germaine, and the Luxemburg gardens. The two great museums, Louvre and Orsay, are somewhat farther, but still within comfortable walking distance. We even walked with our six year old back from the Eiffel tower, following the banks of the river and then Boulevard Saint-Germaine; a very nice, but long walk. The metro station (Odeon) is just steps away and there are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes nearby. It is a touristy area of Paris, where you are just as likely to meet fellow travelers as locals. Since we like researching hotels before we go, we rarely have surprises. This time, we had a pleasant one. We’ve expected a standard continental breakfast, little more than coffee, baguette and butter and were pleasantly surprised that there was a much better variety of food, including cold cuts, cheeses, yoghurts, and cereals. We didn’t rate this hotel the usual way, by comparing it to other hotels we’ve stayed in. Central Paris hotels are a category of their own, with high prices and tiny rooms with windows often opening to dark interior courtyards. Public spaces are cramped, if they exist at all, and hotels offer few services. It would perhaps make sense to compare it to other Paris hotels, but while we have been to Paris before, we don’t have that much personal experience with Paris hotels. We gave this hotel top rating because after hours of research online, it was the best we could find for our needs: a comfortable triple room within our price range in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolument the archetypal Parisian experience!”
Reviews.Author: SojournerTraveller
Reviews.Content: Accompanying sister and sister-in-law for their first ever weekend in Paris, I decided we could do with a little more elegance and old world Parisian atmosphere than the usual small hotel in St Germain des Pres I have stayed in since my student days. A friend (who had stayed in the fabulous suite with a view of Notre Dame - unfortunately beyond our budget) recommended the Hotel Left Bank and said to disregard any suggestion of chain mediocrity the Best Western ownership might conjure up, as this was truly a unique hotel. So we splurged, and although this is more than I would usually spend on a hotel room, our room became so much a part of our lovely weekend experience. Although right in the heart of St Germain, just around the corner from the cafes and stalls of the Rue de Buci and just up the road from the buzz of St Michel, you walk off the street into a small medieval reception room with beautifully carved furniture and tapestry wall hangings. In our triple room, more antique furniture with a standout carved wardrobe, the fabric on the wall matching the bedspread and curtains, with french windows opening onto a small subtlely lit planted courtyard. But by far the outstanding aspect of Hotel Left bank is Lorette, the concierge without parallel, only one of whose amazing abilities is procuring sold out tickets with 5 minutes notice, and who epitomises the friendly, elegant style of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Value”
Reviews.Author: Kat1157
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Close to Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, Pantheon, Left Bank vendors and Latin Quarter restaurants. We walked everywhere. Lots of people-watching available from nearby cafes. Room was a standard Parisian room - enough space for a bed and a couple of suitcases. There were closets/drawers to put clothes away; but, we were only there two nights so we did not unpack. An awesome breakfast is included. Standard American choices such as yogurt, cereal, juice, etc. Also included was coffee with hot milk, hot chocolate and a variety of french breakfast breads and meats. Free Wi-Fi in your room and a free computer available in a cute parlor. Great value for a modest price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to return”
Reviews.Author: smartsweet13
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this quaint hotel....staff was very helpful and went beyond to attend to our needs. Our room was cleaner than a number of others we've stayed at. We do plan on staying here again....the location was great. Within walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “The quadruple room was a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: familyoffour33052
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris with our 2 teenage kids. The 1st time around we stayed at the hotel suite on the 6th floor for 5 days and it was great! Besides the fact that the breakfast was quite mediocre , we were very happy. When we came back to Paris after being in south of France, we got the quadruple room on the main floor. Even though I specifically requested a room higher up. I made the reservations 3 months in advanced and when we left for Southern France I specifically asked to be as high as possible ( they have 4 different quadruple rooms on different floors ) We spent 1575 Euros in the 1st 5 nights in the hotel and I felt that we were treated badly. This room should not even be considered a room in a 3 star hotel- There is no window that opens to the outside and I could hardly breath. The next morning the front desk ( Sinan who tried to do his best and is very nice) asked how was my night and I told him I was very upset. He refunded us 40 Euros. This was a nice gesture but it was too late and too litlle. This horrible room cost us 250 Euros after the 40Euros discount! It was a pity to end up our great trip disappointed like that. It could have ended up differently if the hotel would have treated us a bit better.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of San Marino, San Marino
Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Franci94
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a great location, surrounded by restaurants, bars and lots of locals. You a re a minute walk form the metro and 5 minute walk from Notre Dame and Louvre. The staff is simply fabulous. Mr. Ewan Sinan at the reception was so friendly and helpful. He arranged for us so many things and we really loved him! I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “perfectly placed for a relaxed city trip yet peaceful in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: karene47
Reviews.Content: An ideal location for a young family. We had our 3 month old son with us and were very well looked after. Staff were wonderful, looking after him while we ate breakfast on one occasion! Helpful and interested.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: ihearteuropelots
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again. The hotel is centrally located, the staff was helpful, breakfast and free wifi were included in the price and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Anywhere Else. Hidden Gem"”
Reviews.Author: AshleyFamily
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in alot of nice places in my life but never one that I loved so much as this. It is located on a tiny street in an amazing neighborhood. I almost dont want to leave a review because I want to keep it all to myself. It truly made our whole vacation. It is extremely safe, lively, classic and traditional. You are a 1 minute walk from the metro, 5 min walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. Restaurants, cafes fill the area. Left the kids (15 & 11) in hotel while we went to nightclubs closeby and often let them walk around late at night. It is an extremely SAFE neighborhood. Staff fabulous. Breakfast & rooms are small. Rooms have plenty of space to put away clothes and suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: BagsRPacked16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy walking distance to Notre Dame and the Louvre. There are lots of shops and restaurants on the same street and in this neighborhood. It is a historic area of Latin Quarter that is populated by lots of young trendy Parisians. Staff is extremely helpful and beds were comfy. Our room looked out over a courtyard with a cathedral in the background. Breakfast is included with the room and was a beautiful array of meats, eggs, pastries, cheeses and fruits. Lobby computer has European keyboard. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: TravelEurope87
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, great location, surrounded by restaurants, bars, lively and lots of locals. Hotel service was great, clean, and safe. Doors locked at midnight but can get in by ringing the bell after this time. Close to Odeon metro to access all Paris sites and near Notre Dame. Breakfast was okay, could use more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: goodthistimeofyear
Reviews.Content: If you get a good deal through an Internet booking company this is a great value for money hotel in a smashing location!!!! Check out the small shops close by, get a take-away crepe for dessert after a great meal in the Latin quarter, only a 10 min walk away! There are multiple metro stations near by. Literally 5 min walk from Saint Chapelle and Notre Dame. Sneeky note- the zone 1-3 carnet tickets will get you to Versailles from St michel RER station, but u need to buy a ticket back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: ZoeJetRocket
Reviews.Content: Great staff made us feel welcome. Lovely breakfast. Room was well organized and clean. Large bathroom, heated towel rack. We spent a little more and got more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied customers”
Reviews.Author: Pontyposse
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from all hotel staff - from the waitress in the breakfast room, to each of the reception staff. Everyone friendly and approachable. Rooms clean and comfortable. Great sleep quality at back of hotel in the family room but early morning street noise bothered my elderly parents at the front (on one morning only). Great location near to Odeon Metro and 10mins walk to Notre Dame. Good local cafes, resturants and pubs with relaxed cosmopolitan atmosphere. We would have liked to have access to a tea/coffee tray & kettle in the room (didn't want to visit reception in pyjamas to ask for drinks!)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cjd0
Reviews.Content: Two night stay - no complaints. Great location. Convenient for visit to nearby Musee D'Orsay where we also enjoyed also a pleasant lunch. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy again - prime spot”
Reviews.Author: VEROPALO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights in the Best Western Left Bank from 28th January. We had perviously stayed there with our children for a week in October 2009. Last time we had the suite, this time the double on the top floor, which was E230 a night. We love this hotel and would definately stay again. It is the best location with easy walks to so many sights, and so many excellent cafes and restaurants. Shopping is great, metros are close and it's just a great area for us. The receptionists are all friendly with some being very friendly, and are all helpful, with some being very helpful. They kept mail for us and booked a couple of restuarants for us. We had emailed them asking them to book a shuttle from the airport for us, but this didn't turn up and when we phoned the shuttle company they said that there was no shuttle booked for us. Not sure who was at fault but it was inconvenient and the taxi we had to catch was almost triple the cost of the shuttle. Also on the morning we left, we had asked the receptionist to book a taxi to the station, and she had said to check out with 20 minutes to spare for her to call the taxi. Well, it actually took 50 minutes for the taxi to arrive and if I hadn't planned on arriving at the station so early, we would have missed our train. I think that pre-booking the night before would make me feel better. The double on the 6th floor, is very spacious by French hotel standards and has a great view of Notre Dame. We used the free wifi both in our room and in the lobby. The bathroom was great with a shower over the bath. In a perfect world the towels would be bigger and whiter but that never seems to happen anywhere. The breakfast is more than adequate, with juice and hot drinks, cold meat and cheeses, friut, cereals, boiled eggs and plenty of pastries and cakes. We have no complaints at all about the breakfast, and it certainly is enough to sustain you for hours. On the morning we arrived, our room wasn't ready but we were able to store our luggage, and we were then offered coffee and tea, which we accepted. It came with a basket of pastries and croissants, and we were not charged for this first breakfast, which was very nice. Overall, we are very happy with Left Bank and would go back anytime we are in Paris. I hope that all the renovations do not mean that they will put up their rates, as they are already at the top of our price range.

Reviews.Title: “So French!!”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little expensive but compared to the rest in the area was much cheaper. We wanted a central place to stay, that was safe so Saint Germain was at the top of the list and so was this hotel. The hotel is very French from its exterior to the room we had. We had a triple which was a longer room than normal ones. The decor was awesome!!! You knew you were in Paris by staying here. I loved the motif they had that was in the room, the way the room was set out and the furniture that was in it. It was just so french and everything you want to have a Parisian feeling on a trip to Paris. I loved it!! The breakfast was really nice, you got Croissants each morning as well as toast, cereal etc. It was a great way to start the day. There is alot of Nutella too, which i have always loved so that was a bonus each morning. They would also cook eggs for you if you wanted them. The hotel is central. It is a few streets down from the Pont Des Art Bridge which is my favourite bridge in Paris and was used in the last episode of Sex and the City. The Louvre is not far from this bridge on the other side of the Seine and Notre Dame is probably 20 min walk from the hotel. The Eiffel Tower is a 10min drive which is all the way on the other side of Paris compared to where the Louvre is but we took a taxi and were there quite quickly. It really is the best area to stay in Paris. We walked around Paris which you should do here so Saint Germain was a good place to begin that walk. There are alot of cafes, restaurants that we ate at which were really nice right around the corner. And souvenirs a plenty in the same strip. There was also a lovely jewelry shop on the corner that we bought a few things from and it was cheap enough. The only downside we had was on checking out. The cleaner one day of the 4 nights we stayed said we had taken bottles of coke out of the snack bar, because my friends had empty bottles on their nightstands from the day before. We knew we didnt take anything out of there so reception waived it so we didnt have to pay which was good. it just made me wonder how do they check when someone uses the snacks in the room, do they check it is full each morning?? Or just go by what you have sitting in the room like what we did and assume you have taken something that's in there?? It wasnt a big issue for us and was resolved immediately so i would gladly stay here again next time i am in Paris regardless of this. You want the whole Paris feeling when your in Paris, a comfortable room and a good location. This hotel gives you all of that for much cheaper than what is out there in the same area so why stay anywhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Paper-Thin Doors & Renovation Work Overshadow Hotel Charm”
Reviews.Author: kmmtth
Reviews.Content: We’ve been to Paris many times and we always stay in a boutique hotel (hotel du charme) because we want the ambiance of the old world ~ beautiful fabrics, huge beams on the ceiling, romantic furnishings. We are also seasoned travelers and understand the potential drawbacks of them – small rooms and bathrooms, not the best sound-proofing, tiny elevators. Having said that, we were disappointed with this hotel and give it only 3 stars out of 5. Here are the good and the bad regarding the Left Bank Hotel in St. Germaine: THE GOOD: The renovated 17th century building is lovely and retains much of its architectural heritage ~ original beams on the ceilings and in the breakfast area, a nicely maintained courtyard garden, period furnishings Great location in the heart of St. Germain des Pres Really nice breakfast with fruit, toast, cheese, deli meats, and a basket of baked goods for each table is brought to you with your coffee and served until 11am each day Our room, #205, is one of the 50% that was recently renovated, with toile wallpaper, beams on the ceiling, large ‘parisian’ window looking out to the courtyard, and a huge bathroom that felt like a modern hotel with marble counter and enough space for two people Shuttle service is available for a fee to the airport or surrounding hotels on your day of departure (this seems to be standard with other hotels in that neighborhood) Breakfast servers and cleaning people very nice THE BAD: Construction Noise: since the hotel is only partially renovated, they are ‘working’ on the other rooms. “Boom Boom Boom…..pause….Boom Boom Boom….pause….Boom Boom Boom” went on the entire time we were there from around 10am to 5 pm. We were told the work was two floors up but it was loud enough that it kept us from being able to take a nap upon our arrival, severely jet-lagged, and annoying enough that when we were in the room during the day, it began to drive us nuts. Paper-thin doors and walls with no insulation made it seem that everyone who got off the elevator was actually standing in our room. I asked about the ‘sound-proofing’ that is advertised on their website and was told that yes, it is being done, but no, it is not possible to achieve much of a result due to the age of the building. We think the owners would be wise to replace the doors and insulate around them as this may help with some of the noise. We heard every person who got off the elevator or was in the hallway during our stay. A special thank you to the obnoxious Americans who were roaring drunk and stood in the hall singing at midnight– note to that group – get some manners! Condescending Attitude of Staff: When I went down to ask about the construction noise, I ended up in a 45 miniute conversation, in french, that progressed from: “Madame, you would not like to stay in a room with dirty carpet so we have to make these improvements” and factoids shared “Madame, the room you are in normally is 2x the price during fashion week” and finally, “Madame, you may choose to stay in a new hotel where noise will not be a problem but you have chosen to stay in the heart of Paris…” to: “Madame, I can offer you another room for your last 2 nights or even upgrade you to a superior room on your last night” This was an interesting and long exchange but I found the attitude lacking in a real interest to help with the problem or at least compensate us for the constant work going on. In fact, we even got down to granularity in the French language as I called it ‘construcion’ and he called it merely ‘travail’ or light work. I would have felt so much better if we had been offered a discount on our next stay at the hotel, or given some other type of compensation, as a matter of goodwill. The attitude, however, was one of ‘tant pis’ or ‘too bad.’ Consequently, I spent the rest of the time stopping at other boutique hotels and touring their rooms, so that we have a shortlist for our next stay there. ‘Tant pis!’ NOTE: Our room (#205) was 4 feet from the elevator. Each of the rooms ending in ‘1’ is about 2 feet from the elevator. So, you have been warned about these rooms (room 101, 201, etc. and room 205, 305 etc.) RESULTING RECOMMENDATION: The noise from the hallway along with the constant hammering overshadowed the positives of this hotel. We’ll be staying elsewhere in the neighborhood during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank elegance and convenience!”
Reviews.Author: ozzygal5
Reviews.Content: we spent two nights at this charming hotel just a short walking distance from Odeon metro station and within easy walking distance of many of the sights of Paris. Ignore the Best Western sign-this is not run of the mill! The hotel is on a busy street but has a welcoming entrance with a cosy sitting area close to the reception desk. There is a lift-just as well as there is no one to help with luggage. Our room was stunning-much bigger than expected with a gorgeous fabric floral wall paper, antique furniture and a comfy sofa. The bed was blissfully comfortable and we even had a statue of a nymph on the coffee table! The bathroom was small but modern -nice shower, hot water and newly decorated. Everything was clean. Breakfast was great, a basket of fresh bread and croissants served individually and normal buffet items such as cereal, bread for toasting, cold meats and cheese, fruit etc available as well. I loved my personal pot of fresh coffee with warm milk. This is a great hotel to stay in and I would certainly go back there. It's not cheap but it's in a brilliant position. The lovely young man on reception during the day was very charming and helpful and spoke good English-and we were able to leave our bags in a secure cupboard on our last day. The only downside is that the rooms are close together and we could hear the people in the room next door talking, showering etc. Could be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Second time, again great experience!”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in Best Western Premier Left Bank - St Germain and it was even better. All rooms are being renovated and they kept the lovely atmosphere, the great old paris style, just excellent. Location couldn't be better, the staff is really nice: we had more contact with Sinan who was very helpful and polite. The lady who attends the dining area was also very nice every morning. Just great!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location!”
Reviews.Author: Iarabsb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Near good restaurants and cafés! The neighborhood is very agreable! Also it has great service! The welcome receptionist- Sinan was of great help by making us reservations for dinners and providing information about the city. The breakfast is delicious, few choices but great bread, rolls, jam, croissant... The room is small, but very confy and clean! The bathroom is also great- even the standart room has a tub

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Trixie777
Reviews.Content: Was a great choice: location couldn't have been better, very clean throughout, room small as expected but not too small and well decorated, all staff v friendly and helpful - front desk, breakfast & cleaners, liked view of bustling street and double glazing meant no noise from road.

Reviews.Title: “All you need at a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin2818
Reviews.Content: Charming European hotel. Rooms are fairly small but clean and comfortable and tastefully decorated. Great location 100 yards from Odeon Metro stop. Wi fi and breakfast included. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in the hotel suite”
Reviews.Author: kymberand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in summer 2010. We were six people in total - four adults, a teenager and a toddler - and we stayed together in the suite on the sixth floor. This room was an amazing find - we paid 300 euros per night (booked directly with the hotel) for all of us in a really perfect location. The room rate also includes free breakfast, which we found rather unimpressive (but free, unlike many Paris hotels) as well as free wireless internet - but the signal didn't reach the sixth floor so we ended up sitting in the lobby or on the stairs. The suite itself was really perfect, and entirely unique in this central location (it was the only place we found that could accomodate all of us). The suite is divided into two rooms: the "bedroom", which has a permanent double bed, pullout single bed, armchair and desk, and the "living area" which has a couch that converts into two single beds, several small tables and chairs, and a minibar. The bathroom is clean and fairly spatious. We also had a baby crib set up in the living area, and the room was not overly crowded. There is a view of Notre Dame out the window of the bedroom, and a partial view of the Eiffel tower out the window of the living room. Everything was clean and the decor was nice (there are photos on the hotel web site). Service at the hotel was rather mixed - some of the front desk staff were quite friendly, while others were borderline rude. The breakfast staff were all generally rather rude. Overall we really enjoyed the stay and would absolutely recommend this hotel, particularly for anyone travelling with a small group.

Reviews.Title: “good value, very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: KAS09
Reviews.Content: good location, great value. tacky decor in rooms, but bathrooms recently renovated and room was clean! small hotel, cordial staff that is attentive to security.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lamberto_Buti
Reviews.Content: perfect location for restaurant and metro. Near to Notre Dame and clean room. the suite has an amazing view thru the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room ruined my stay!”
Reviews.Author: lckthumper
Reviews.Content: I've been planning a trip to Paris for two years, and based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, this hotel was my first choice for a Paris hotel. The room was good sized and clean, but we dealt with noise both nights of our stay. I thought we had noisy neighbors. One of the sounds we kept hearing was a chair being dragged along the floor. The second night of our stay was very noisy. It sounded like a party going on in the lobby below us. I even got dressed and went down to the lobby, but it was empty. I then realized that our room shared a common wall with the restaurant next door, Le Procope. The noise we were experiencing was from a party at the restaurant. I primarily rent a hotel room for a good nights sleep. I could not believe that this hotel put us in a room where we were guaranteed to have our sleep disturbed. We literally had a party going on in the room next to us! The noise lasted til 2am in the morning, with people arguing . This was our last night and we had to leave early the next day to fly home, or I would have called to see if we could change rooms. But why would they put us in a room that shared a wall with a noisy restaurant if they had other rooms available? We paid for a good nights sleep and that was not provided. I still cannot believe this hotel knowingly put us in a room that shared a common wall with a noisy restaurant. Ruined our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible place to stay on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: NJM20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an overall magnificent experience. The location is ideal for walking to all attractions and cafes on the Left Bank, the room was excellent and comfortable, and the breakfast was out of this world. We fueled up on the diverse offerings at breakfast, and we didn't need to eat again until later in the day. It is easy walking distance to the Odeon Metro stop, but we found that we could walk to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Seine, many historic churches, and the neighborhood of Rue de Buci brassieres were within sight. I cannot express how pleased we were with this hotel. If I return to Paris, I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent, quaint, cosy find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: KaiTor
Reviews.Content: After looking at so many options in Paris - including Hotels, B&Bs and Apartments, we decided on the Left Bank as it provided the best of location and price competitiveness. We found the location is indeed fabulous - close to many excellent restaurants and shops, the Metro, and a number of tourist must-sees. All staff were very helpful - front desk, service and breakfast room. The breakfasts are a great way to start a day in Paris. The front desk gladly allowed us to leave our luggage long before we were due to check in, and were most helpful on lots of other things touristique.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, distincitve French character, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JontyH
