Reviews.Content: From start to finish our whole experience went just as we'd hoped. Relaxed, informal and efficient greeting. Uniquely decorated rooms and spotlessly clean. Generous continental breakfast. Location excellent with plenty of life but not too much noise. Easy access to prime sites. Helpful and tolerant staff.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect - atmosphere, location and service”
Reviews.Author: kiwiview
Reviews.Content: You couldn't get a better 3 star property. Only a short stroll from the Metro (Odeon), short walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. The hotel is cosy, with a real French flavour - so fitting on our visit to Paris. The service was brilliant and we were fortunate to get a beautifully appointed room with views to the Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in Paris center”
Reviews.Author: Auli51
Reviews.Content: Hotel Left Bank is as the name says situated on the left bank of Seine, close to Notre Dame and only some steps from Odeon. This hotel offers cosy surrounding in a central position and in the heart of the Latin quarter. The service is kind and warm. The hotel is neat and nicely decorated. Our room was very quiet facing the inside court. The room is equiped with a practical good bathroom and free wireless internet connection. The breakfast table is good and is offered daily till 11am allowing a nice morning rest. Our room was rather small but sufficient for our couple for the three night stay. We would be happy to return to this friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Left Bank is a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyTodd
Reviews.Content: A small, but clean room with a comfortable bed and a clean, new full bathroom in a great location (two minute walk from the Odeon Metro station and right in the middle of St. Germain/Latin Quarter districts) made this a wonderful, value hotel for us in Paris. The front desk staff were a pleasure to deal with. Always courteous, friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast.. Easy walking distance to Ile de la cite, Louvre and many other Paris locations ... and easy Metro access for any others. We were in a 5th floor room facing the street. No problem whatsoever with noise at night. Lower floors might be a little noisy with windows open as folks are on street late into the night here, but that's part of the Paris atmosphere! We highly recommend this area of Paris to stay in and the Hotel Left Bank was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late September 2010. Extremely pricey (250 euro per night!) which I can understand was all about the great location - but not much more to write about. Hotel is old with dated furniture (others may say it has "character"). Reception were helpfuland friendly. Rooms were of average size, mini bar, flat screen TV. Breakfast was not great - croissants and bread were not fresh even though there was a perfect bakery across the road!) The location is the only plus: plenty of eateries, bakeries seconds away; minutes away from Notre Dame Cathedral and St Gemrain metro station. If youre willing to pay over the odds for the location and nothing else - this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of Ten for location alone”
Reviews.Author: gsnicho
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was our first Paris experience. The hotel is located right in the heart of the Saint Germain area with plenty of restaurants & bars right on your doorstep. Our room was well appointed and tastefully decorated, The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming, the continental buffet breakfast was also something to look forward to every morning ... they served up the very best coffee of our entire trip. We will be staying with them again when next in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: samanthaonstyle
Reviews.Content: Let's face it: Paris is overpriced, especially when it comes to hotels. I kept putting off booking a hotel for my trip to Paris because everything is either ridiculously expensive or poorly reviewed. I then stumbled upon the Best Western Left Bank on LastMinute.com. The reviews were good, and the Best Western website had a decent deal: approximately 800 euros for three nights including tax. We booked it a week before our trip and hoped for the best. My boyfriend and I like luxury, but we weren't willing to spend thousands of dollars. Overall, I was pleased and would stay again if I was traveling to Paris on a budget. The positives: 1. The staff was very polite and helpful, and all (at the front desk) spoke perfect English. There was a problem with my credit card, and rather than canceling the reservation, they quickly contacted me and helped resolve it. They also helped us arrange our transportation back to the airport since there was a strike the day we left. 2. The room was small, but spacious for Paris--and very clean. It had a large, comfortable bed, full-size desk, and plenty of room for two to move around without feeling claustrophobic. It had a nice window that opened over a small courtyard. 3. The bathroom was a good size, and large for Paris. It had a glass wall and real shower, rather than just a tub like many Paris hotels. The toiletries weren't very good, but that's a non-issue for me as I like to bring my own. 4. GREAT location. It's in the artsy Left Bank, close to the Sorbonne and many (less expensive) bars and cafes. I wish we had explored the bar scene more, actually, but we were often tired from long days of sightseeing. It's also very close to a Metro line (Saint Michel) and a quick walk to many of the main attractions, like the Pompidou and Notre Dame. You can take a leisurely walk to the Champs Elysees and Eiffel Tower, or easily take the Metro. There's also a fantastic bakery across the street with pain au chocolate for 1 euro! 5. Free wireless in the common areas AND guest rooms. (You have to sign up for an account, but it's still free.) A couple complaints: 1. DON'T GET YOUR LAUNDRY DONE HERE. It's a total rip off. We spent over 70 euros cleaning two men's shirts, two men's undershirts, a pair of women's pants, and a handful of underwear/boxers. It turns out they took it to a nearby launderer; I'm sure we could have taken it ourselves for one fourth of the price. 2. They lock the main door after about 10 or 11pm, and you have to ring the doorbell to have the doorman come get you. It's never a major problem nor wait, but it's a little bit irritating if you like to stay out late in Paris! 3. There's no outdoor space. Considering the prices in Paris, we would have appreciated a garden or rooftop in which to enjoy cheap champagne and cheese from the grocery store. The courtyard was pleasant to look at, but there was no way to access it. The indoor space was small and very old-fashioned Paris, but pleasant enough. Overall, the hotel was great and I have no major complaints. I'd stay again, although next time I would probably splurge a bit more on the hotel and plan to get some groceries rather than eating all my meals out. (But, I thought the food in Paris is overrated anyway!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location with helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: Traveler33418
Reviews.Content: Terrific location walking distance to Metro, Notre Dame, Louvre, St. Sulpice and other key sites in Paris. Front desk staff helped with restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay in this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: sglassman123
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, but this was my first Best Western stay. I was impressed by how nice it was. The staff at the front desk were very helpful. The room was excellent, and my granddaughter and I enjoyed the breakfasts. Also, the location is great. It is in walking distance to the Louvre, the d'Orsay, Notre Dame, and many more sights. Also, there are an abundance of restaurants and shops all around the hotel. I will definitely stay in this hotel again, and I have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Even better front desk.”
Reviews.Author: tennisb19
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with 3 other friends we are all in our mid twenties. I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and some of the worst. This hotel is fantastic! Are the rooms a little small? Sure its Europe. The location is why we booked this hotel. We walked to everything from sights to restaurants you cannot be more central! Yet this is not the reason we will be back. The reason for coming back was the amazing front desk and a gentlmen I think named Ewin. This man was imperative to finding what we were looking for and making unforgettable suggestions. I am a chef and he told me to check out a sunday organic market, around the block. It was a memory for a lifetime! Thank you to all the great staff but Ewin thank you especially to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: kathync1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find in Paris. The hotel room was of adequate size, very modern bathroom with large tub and shower. The room size was larger than some other large cities. Old world ambience. Breakfast buffet consists of ham, salami, cheese, hard boiled egg, yogurt, cereals, assorted breads, juice, etc. and is included in room price. Front desk was very helpful, especially Sinan who made restaurant reservations, taxi reservation to airport for us and generally good information and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller23
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a better location in Paris. In the heart of the left bank, surrounded by excellent bistros, cafes, patisseries, boutiques, creperies, and within walking distance of most of Paris' historic sites and attractions, this charming hotel is a peaceful oasis. The rooms are clean, beautifully decorated, the bathrooms are modern, staff is friendly and helpful. They even have a room that will accomodate four children, a rarity in Paris! The neighbourhood is lively at night but feels very safe, and the rooms facing the inner courtyard are quiet. The location is a couple of blocks from the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral, Jardin de Luxembourg and much more. This hotel provides excellent value as a home vase for tourism and shopping. Highly recommended for families. We would return to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff :)”
Reviews.Author: OAP07
Reviews.Content: As a mature married couple we found the hotel was perfect for us, and thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay. Even though we arrived early, our room was ready and waiting - The standard room was cosy, clean and comfortable - we loved the decor in the room (and indeed throughout the entire hotel). The buffet breakfast sported an adequate selection of food. Hotel Left Bank is in a great location, being in the centre of the bustling St Germain des Pres district and close to lots of tourist spots. Our only quibble was that there was no tea or coffee-making facilities in the room. We would definately consider staying here again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Splurge a little for Paris Rooftop Suite”
Reviews.Author: Sodawells
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a hotel room for four people (2 adults, 2 kids) when we stumbled upon website of hotel we had stayed at on our honeymoon 15 years ago. Booked and stayed in room 604, a top floor suite with views of Notre Dame and Eiffel Tower. The staff could not have been nicer, very helpful, always a smile. Suite had a divider between the bed areas. We know we give it 5 dots and this is not a typical 5 star hotel suite. We give it high marks for the Paris roof top views, both kids (7,12) thought it was cool and awesome, wife and I took a million pictures as the sun set. Stay up till 11 to watch The Eiffel Tower twinkle. Hundreds of restaurants within easy walking distance. Near Metro, easy walk to Louvre and Notre Dame. There is also a little laundry around the corner if needed.

Reviews.Title: “charming 17th century hotel, helpful informative staff”
Reviews.Author: riricroc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and was impressed by the beautiful antique furnishings in the lounge, with carved wooden furniture including a sedan chair, Oriental carpets, Aubusson. wall hangings. Staff very helpful and informative, able to advise on metro lines to see sights, available parking etc. Superb location few minutes quick stroll to Notre Dame. In heart of trendy left ban area, with many cafes and brasserie and we had best moules and steak ever nearby for 12E. Lovely room, with marble tiles bathroom, good size bath. Lovely buffet breakfast choice, with fresh ham, coffee in large jugs brought to table, basket of croissants and rolls. Great romantic place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovefrance2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find for us. It's hard finding a room for 4 with a/c and in a good location. Although it was a bit pricey, the accomodations were great. The room was a good size and VERY quiet. The staff was great. They speak English when your French is not quite up to par. Very knowledgeable about the area. Quick to aid you in reservations. Location was PERFECT. Less than a block to the metro and within walking distance of MANY popular attractions. Also, a zillion cafes right outside your door! A minus -- the lift wasn't working 50% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great; front desk staff not”
Reviews.Author: selzanelli
Reviews.Content: Room #404 was nice and roomy with comfortable beds but hallways very narrow. Free use of computer in lobby! My cousin and I checked in on a Sunday afternoon wanting to go to the museum. Front desk woman said it was a short walk. When we got there, they were closing. We also asked her about restaurants for dinner. She told us most all were closed on Sundays and steered us to a dinner cruise on the Seine for $95/pp. Food was average and wine was undrinkable. On our taxi ride home, every restaurant was open with people enjoying the wonderful weather. She also "sold" us on taking the shuttle to the airport as the taxi would be twice as much. They didn't have room on the 8 am shuttle, so put us on the 7:30. My cousin is 80 and didn't get ready in time, so we had to take a taxi. She told us since we booked it, we had to pay for it. Asked her to put us on the next one, but she said it was still full. I argued so she didn't charge us. We took a taxi costing a total of $40, $10 less than the shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MrsF38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location - very near to the St Michel RER stop - hence v. easy for the airport. Only a few minutes walk to Notre Dame. The rooms were comfortable and the staff very friendly. Had booked a twin room and was given a triple room 1st night and then had to move to a twin for 2nd night onwards. Quite disgruntled at this, but they did send someone to move our luggage early in the day (so that we could leave early to spend the day at Versailles).

Reviews.Title: “Vgood Location, good service, charme, high price, avg bkfst,avg room”
Reviews.Author: FedericoeChiara
Reviews.Content: from 17 to 20 july 2010 around 350 euros night 1 family room. This is the very center of the action: very lively at night, excellent transport opportunities, most charming area of paris, open (and dear) market daytime. Hotel features XVIII century pieces and it is charming, but everything tends to be small and a little old. Room was again small but we slept well in it. it gave on the internal small yard without light but no noise. Free unlimited wifi inroom Breakfast sports industrial croissant (!), fried eggs are extra, no bacon, cappuccino extra, no musli (but some cereals), no fruits, 2 types of decent juice. Personnel is not french, decently trained, we missed the touch (even though french personnel can be very unpleasant) but it was willing to help (except with the luggage). during our stay no better deal was available, still I consider it overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation and service do not match the tree star rating”
Reviews.Author: Martine7730
Reviews.Content: Reserved a suite (party of four) on the last floor for 5 nights. No mention when reserved that some bedding would be a couch and a roll-away bed. Love seat and armchair completely worn out. Water temperature in shower fluctuated constantly. Breakfast was very skimpish for a three star hotel; STALE french bread and pastries, no fresh fruit, yogurt available some of the time only. Front desk staff not always welcoming. Hotel has a very good location and the view on the top floor was nice. Disappointed with the overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stokes5000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 night stay at this hotel. I highly recommend it! The location was excellent! Numerous cafes, restaurants and take out food shops were nearby. It's a half block from the Odeon metro station and easy walking distance to several major sites. The hotel staff spoke English and were always helpful with anything we needed. We had one room for the 4 of us and there was plenty of space. There is a full breakfast included which is very convenient! The food was great too! Our room was quiet with 2 large windows that opened into the couryard area. The price of the room was a very good value! The best part was being able to have one room for all 4 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lyndie2U
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. This is a no-frills hotel that is perfectly located in a tourist area of Paris. Do not expect luxury or nice appointments. The rooms are small, the lift is small but it has everything you need, including an owner who speaks English. I went outside to smoke. The night doorman, whom others have also commented is a bit cranky, got irritated with me and told me to smoke inside. We were not told that breakfast was included when we arrived. The internet is a local hotspot, very unreliable. Should have free access to the hotel network

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lsgoodman
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the perfect area,lots of restauants,outdoor cafes.close to odean metro. rooms quiet, and the women at front desk will help you with everything you need,with a great smile. breakfast very good. i would stay there any time in paris. goodmans--pittsburgh pa

Reviews.Title: “Comming back to enjoy more of the City!”
Reviews.Author: travis46062
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. The staff work very hard to help us because we do not speak french. We will do better next time. We walked every where and the location made the walks to the Louvre, the Efiel Tower, museums and tourist spots great. We are fans of Ernst Hemmingway too so we could walk to the resturants or cafes in this books. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: cbrusky
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, and I was again very pleased. The location is great, and we also always get great restaurant recommendations. This trip I was traveling with my daughter and three of her university aged friends and the staff were willing to research recommendations for nightclubbing spots. The bedroom for 3 was comfortable and having breakfast included is a wonderful bonus. Great location to walk to many sights, access the Metro, and to wander wonderful neighborhoods and shops. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MaryEarth
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Left Bank was wonderful. We traveled with children and grandparents and all thought the hotel was terrific. The rooms are undergoing renovation, were lovely and surprisingly roomy. The breakfast was delicious and the staff were very hospitable. The location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than we thought -- and the air conditioning saved us!”
Reviews.Author: Lanie54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recently in Paris during the first heat wave of summer. We normally do not choose Best Westerns -- it's hard to know if they have been refurbished and they don't always have the "boutique" feel we like. However, after suffering for 3 nights in a so-called small, charming hotel that promised air conditioning --but actually had none -we were at our wits end. We had walked by the BW a few times (our original hotel was just 2 blocks away) and it looked quite nice, too too big and with some style. We walked in on Sat morning, explained the situation, and they could not have been nicer -- showed us to a very large "superior" room on an interior courtyard, very quiet, and very cool. We grabbed it, and with continental breakfast included, plus free internet and a computer in the lobby, it was barely 20 euros more per night than the tiny, hot room we had before. The hotel is tastefully furnished, admittedly the style is a bit more "chain" hotel than we usually prefer, but it was very nice, very clean, and very comfortable. Next time we might opt for a room facing the front of the hotel, so that you could have the benefit of a bit of a view and little more light, but we were totally focused on quiet and airconditioning after 3 nights of heat and noise. (And we know we had one of the larger rooms, so we do recommend considering the size you want) The hotel is in a great location (as was our first hotel) -- St. Germain de Pres is wonderful......tons of shops, restaurants, cafes and walking distance to absolutely everything. The staff was very pleasant and very helpful and thanks to them we booked a shuttle back to Charles de Gaulle at a very reasonable price, skipping the small hassle of the train and missing the higher cost of a taxi. Many thanks for saving our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing room - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Travel_10237
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very nice, easily reachable by metro. Many of the classic parisian sights are accessible by foot. Nightlife in the area is very lively. The room was small, which is off course normal in Paris. Somehow the room was dark and not very fresh and overall very uninspiring. The bathroom (which had a barely functioning sliding door) on the other hand, was very clean. Maybe it depends what room you get, but we we're not that happy with the room. There's no secured luggage room, so customers themselves stuff them into a small phone booth, all luggage on top of each other. With this price I would expect a better service from the hotel. The breakfast is minimal, with instant-tasting coffee. There's only one lady serving breakfast in the morning so the food is running out all the time and you sometimes have to wait a long time to get anything. If I ran this hotel, I would get more labour there. Overall, this hotel is absolutely not the worst but very very average. For our visit, this hotel was not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great walk to anywhere location”
Reviews.Author: kbcmnich2
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in a great walk to anywhere location

Reviews.Title: “Choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: PNW
Reviews.Content: I think the room you get will determine how well you like this hotel. We pre-paid via the Best Western website, paying extra for a queen bed and requesting a room in the back. At arrival we were given a room in the front with a very small double bed. My husband questioned it and was told no one was checking out (this was during the volcano chaos) so it was the only room they had. I suppose we were to feel lucky to get a room at all? It bothered me that they didn't offer to either 1) make another guest move to this room so we could have the room we paid for, or 2) offer to refund the extra we'd paid for a queen. Also, the rooms in the front face a very noisy street so we were unable to keep the windows open though it was quite warm. The next day, though the airports were still closed, they moved us to a queen at the back of the hotel. This was a nicer room altogether, with a rooftop view of Notre Dame, a larger bed, and a better layout. In both cases the bathrooms were lovely and new. Breakfast was fine, fairly standard and a little monotonous after a few days--they bring a basket with a baguette and 2 pastries per person, plus there's some cold cuts, yoghurt, and juice. Location is good, about 1/2 block from the Odeon metro stop. Quite a few restaurants and shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Would Return Again”
Reviews.Author: EBach_SanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Ideal Left Bank location near the Odeon Metro Station and St. Germain. The staff was friendly and inside of the hotel is very well done w/ good breakfast. The room was decent size with nice furniture and good Internet access. Bed was comfortable, bathroom clean. I plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JUdyrem
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a fabulous location...one of the best in Paris IMO. Small but charming room with a great buffet breakfast included. The rate was reasonable for the 6er.

Reviews.Title: “nice charming hotel on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: YVR111
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. We had a room on top floor with view of the roof of Paris and Notre-Dame. Breakfast was included in the room price and was excellent. Room small but with lots of charm. Bathroom and especially shower to be upgraded -as most of the french hotels. Overall a very pleasant hotel on the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel...great location!”
Reviews.Author: margarida
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night on the way to Budapest! Direct train from/to Charles de Gaulle and a few steps from the next underground station Odeon . Walking distance to the Louvre,Notre Dame , Gare D`Orsay and close to many cafes and restaurants. Our triple room was very spacious with twin beds and a single one ( a really comfortable single bed for the third person!). Good and clean bathroom too... The room was absolutely quiet and this was a bonus considering the busy area of Saint Germain des Près. Breakfast was included in the rate and was fine...not outstanding but good!Once again a bonus for an expensive city like Paris. This was my 4 th stay in Paris and definitely Hotel Left Bank will be my first choice on my next trip to this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, charming place”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Providence
Reviews.Content: Very charming small hotel is located in a great location just off Rue St.. Germaine, walking distance to the Seine, the Notre Dame, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, etc. The rooms are charming with an antique, wood-paneling feel. Large continental breakfast included for a good value price.

Reviews.Title: “If it were any better, we would never have returned home!”
Reviews.Author: terryyahoo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Left Bank is a wonderful place, with attentive staff, great breakfast buffets and wi-fi included with the room. We stayed up on the top floor, in a 2-room suite with a huge bathroom. The bedroom windows look out upon the towers of Notre Dame cathedral, while the sitting room window with its beautiful wood-beamed sloping ceiling has a terrific view of the Eiffel Tower. We had absolutely no complaints about anything, and the beds were very comfortable. Another good point: the Metro is just half a block from the front door of Hotel Left Bank! (Odeon station)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Worth Consideration”
Reviews.Author: Steve5839
Reviews.Content: This is a very quaint and well placed hotel, close to a tube station and walking distance from Notre Dame. We stopped over at this hotel for the France v England international as a change from the normal hotel we have stopped at in St Germaine before. The rooms were adequate and comfy, but the bathroom was very small. The breakfast was adequate, but not very expansive – this is a 3 star hotel. The staff were very helpful and provided all information, assistance as required and there was free WiFi (that worked) in reception. It was a little expensive, but it is France and Paris in-particular, would I stay there again yes. There is not much more you can say when something is as functional, smoothly operated and gave no cause for concern or elation.

Reviews.Title: “best location for best western”
Reviews.Author: maggiejodenver_CO
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed at the Best Western on the Left Bank and were extremely pleased with the hotel. Our rooms were lovely and the breakfast which was included was great. The location was perfect for the sights we wanted to see particularly the Musee d'Osay. I would highly recommend this hotel to those who would like to have a centrally located and reasonably priced hotel in Paris. The only draw back was the rather unhelpful staff at the front dest but then this is Paris so we were not surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EC19031
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel based on TripAdvisor, and it was excellent. It is very close the Odeon Metro Station, and in proximity to most major sites in central Paris. This was our third visit to Paris and we liked this location and hotel best. The check-in was simple, and the small but functional elevator whisked us to our room, which was large, with comfortable beds, flat screen TV and a good shower (although one morning hot water took several minutes to make its way to the room. The breakfast was substantial for France (great cafe au lait and excellent croissants and baguettes). We got two excellent dinner recommendations from the English-speaking staff for inexpensive restaurants (Try Polidor and Le Boumerang!). The only real drawback was a bathroom door that didn't close all the way, allowing others in the family to hear more than they might wish. We didn't need parking, but they have it available 300 M away for 26 Euros per day. Tip: Cheap soft drinks and snacks available two blocks away at Carefour on Rue Seine).

Reviews.Title: “Great location & cozy”
Reviews.Author: Ukrainka
Reviews.Content: Charming, cozy, beautiful tapestries and heavy wooden work, really atmospheric, small hotel, very Parisian. St Germain is the loveliest district! Quiet street, 2 minutes from river or subway. Great location, 10 points for that. Ok continental breakfast in a cozy (rather small) breakfast area. Friendly staff. Small but nice bathroom with bath. Issues: Soundproof very poor: we had an uber-amorous neighbor which can be romantic for honeymooners, but awful with children or simply to fall asleep. Also you don't wanna sleep there during rain: every drop sounds like a grenade. Room interior rather "red-light district", Parisian yes, but too crimson for my taste. Loved the woodwork though. Lamp on wall was broken (see image).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: Great location within 5 min walk from Saint Chapelle and the Notre Dame. Several cafes and stores nearby (make sure you stop by at Fragonard in Boulevard Sain Germain des Pres). Just at the corner of Boulevard Sain Germain des Pres. I got a room on the first floor and I thought I would wake up very early with the noise from the street but the double glazed windows were just great! Very quiet! The room was small, just like any hotel room in Paris, so news about that. The decoration was just great, very cozy although my room needed some renovation specially the bathroom door. Nevertheless, the bathroon was very clean. Linens too. Breakfast was good, great paté and the lady who served breakfast was very nice, efficient and helpful. Just two things: they charge 3.50 euros for scrambled eggs so if you don't like hard eggs (these are included in breakfast).... soap, shower cap and disposable plastic cups were not changed every day. The disposable cups I had to remember throwing them away so I had new ones on the other day. But overall I would definitely stay there again.The staff was very nice. The hotel is so cozy!! you feel like if you're at home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gems1984
Reviews.Content: I took my Mother to Paris for a two day trip and stayed in this hotel for one night in December. The room was a twin room and was standardly equipped (although not very well lit!) The hotel as a whole was traditional Parisian style and although the included breakfast left a bit to be desired overall it was a very good value hotel with friendly and helpul staff. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: nycrhi
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews indicate this is a great little hotel in a superb location. Rooms are well kept with clean bathrooms. Services and amenities are minimal. The front staff are generally helpful although not engaging. We got great advice from the front staff except one night, 12/7, when there appeared to be what might have been a temp worker? When we asked for restaurant recommendation, he instructed us to look at the menus in the windows, which we did not find all that helpful. Despite this one episode, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, comfortable, convenient and clean.”
Reviews.Author: potsnpots
Reviews.Content: Very well placed for sightseeing in a lovely area. We arrived before midday and did not expect to be able to check in so early but there was no problem. Very clean cosy room with beams, lucky to be at the rear as I suspect it may be a bit noisy at the front.. The receptionist was most helpful and obtained tickets for Moulin Rouge when many of the ticket offices were sold out. Would definately use this lovely hotel again and recommend it. Underground car park just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be on your short list”
Reviews.Author: 4triprev
Reviews.Content: Left Bank Hotel ideally situated for first time visitors. In the heart of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, and a short block away from the Odeon Metro station, making it very convenient as a staging point for visiting just about any site in Paris. Neighborhood is typical Saint-Germain-des-Prés, with lots of “Parisian flavor”. You’ll definitely feel you are in “the real Paris”, although, truth be told, you have to get out of the tourist areas – essentially a +/- 40 block radius from the hotel - to begin to see the “real Paris’ Parisians see daily, as opposed to the tourist center where just about everywhere you look, you see a tourist. But you are there to see the sights, so no matter! I have visited this hotel 3 times in 5 years, staying between a week and 12 days each time. Overall the stay has always rated as “good to very good” (or 3 or 4 out of 5 stars, in terms of service and accommodations, depending on individual preferences and expectations). Note that my rating of “only 3 or 4 stars” reflects the fact that you get satisfaction without any of the pluses you might expect in a larger hotel. No large king size beds, no sitting rooms in your room, no whirlpool bath, no chocolate mint on your pillow. No lounge room or bar, no restaurant in hotel. But you get a very nice, comfortable, quiet, air-conditioned, clean, and safe place to rest after a long day of tourism, for a reasonable price by Paris standards. Hotel is small by American standards (as most European hotels are, unless you are willing to bleed money). Rooms are small but well appointed and clean. Staff is minimal, two, at most three, people at the front desk during the day plus cleaning and service personnel, but all are courteous and most staffers speak English. Night staff consists of a single person at the front desk. Breakfast, generally included in the daily rate, is very nice. Enough choices to satisfy most appetites and to give you a great morning start. Generally served until around 11am – if memory serves. Near the hotel, about a block and a half away, you’ll find about a dozen restaurants, usually open until midnight, a small supermarket, a Laundromat, and various other shops, including 3 superb pastry shops. The hotel is within “walking distance”, here defined as 5 to 10 blocks, from the Sorbonne, Notre Dame, and some of the most famous cafes in Paris, such as Les Deux Magots and Café de Flore (not necessarily recommending these two as they are essentially tourist traps, but worth seeing nonetheless for their historical significance), also near the Latin Quarter, and the Pantheon (be sure to visit). As a basic place to rest your bones, after interminable days of trekking up and down Paris, the hotel rates and overall 4 out of 5. A very good hotel and a great value in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Cozy & Well located”
Reviews.Author: beasnest
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 weeks in Europe, staying in Best Westerns. This one was the best of the 3 that we stayed at. The staff, especially Lorette were very helpful and did everything that they could to make our stay a very pleasant one. They served a very nice continental breakfast, also the best of the 3 BW that we stayed at. On our first stay we had a cozy, but very small room on the street and had to keep the windows closed because of the noise. On our return stay we asked for a room on the backside of the hotel and were given a very spacious room on the 6th floor with a spectacular view of the city and Notre Dame. Having said all that, the best thing about this hotel is the location. It is walking distance to many of the sights and the metro and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The manager at the hotel is wonderful and the hotel charming”
Reviews.Author: Beaux_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming. It is beautifully decorated, the rooms were spacious for Paris, and the baths lovely. Breakfast was good and served in a delightful room. Hotel location is excellent. It is close to many attractions yet the area is not overly touristy. Most importantly, the staff was very nice. We arrived in Paris to realize that we had left our passports in the south of France. The manager was outstanding in helping us retrieve our belongings as soon as possible. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect home in Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: sol5an
Reviews.Content: This cosy hotel is ideally situated in the beautiful district of St Germain. You can easilly reach the most of Paris` sights by foot from this hotel. The hotel itself gives you a warm and cosy fealing. Romantic and nostalgic furniture and decoration. Bedroom as well as bathroom are spacious (our family consisted of kid, teenager, mum and dad and we all had enough space). Cleanliness is good. Breakfast is good and included in the price. Those working in this hotel make you feel very welcomed, they are helpful and they do everything they can to make your stay become perfect. Our french is a bit rusty but the staff speaks English very well. This was our first visit to Paris and the hotel is a part of our positive impression of Paris and France. We are very glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent - great location”
Reviews.Author: jukie1
Reviews.Content: The service was good - location great! Amenities were minimal. We had an awesome view of Notre Dame Cathedral from our room. The room itself was o.k. - a little dark, but the view was great!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on Left Bank Of Paris”
Reviews.Author: PaddyNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Reasonable price for the location. The hotel was clean and the lobby area was charming. The hotel staff were very accommodating having breakfast ready for us for our early departure even though breakfast isn't served until 7am. Hotel is in an ideal location can walk to Luxenbourg Gardens, St. Micheal area, Notre Dame and more. Room was a little on the small side but again this is Paris. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome little Paris hotel, quaint”
Reviews.Author: nm1210
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I loved this little hotel in Left Bank. It was just a stone's throw away from the Louvre, Notre Dame, and other attractions. We loved our room decorated in a Victorian style, the breakfast was surprisingly good, as was the service. Just be aware it's in a touristy area so good restaurants are hard to come by. Make sure you have a good, updated travel guide with restaurant suggestions. Ours was outdated so we didn't really find the best restaurants around us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Ztex
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location . . . within walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame, Cluny, metro stop, river, cafes, etc. Our room was nice with an updated bathroom but the A/C didn't work so we slept with the window open. We asked the front desk for a restaurant recommendation and he pointed us to La Grenouille (traditional French fare) which we loved. The neighborhood is great; I loved all the used book shops and art galleries nearby. We spent two evenings at jazz clubs (also within walking distance). I would definitely recommend this hotel and will return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location.”
Reviews.Author: Mentor189
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with lots of cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance. Room was comfortable with new bath and windows that opened onto a courtyard. Even though it had air conditioning, the fresh air and cooler nights made sleeping very comfortable. Hotel staff was always ready to help and spoke enough English to get things done. Breakfast was great! The breakfast staff was most helpful and always had enough food out through the 7-11 breakfast hour. Coffee, breads, croissants, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, fruit and meats all made a satisfying breakfast. Tour tickets were sold at the desk and a general-use PC was available in the lobby. WiFi was more than adequate from the rooms. Only negative was that the elevator was broken on and off for about 3 days; however the staff offered to carry bags up/down for the guests who were arriving/departing. They did everything possible to get the elevator repaired.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: munstermouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 403. The Good is; great location, very close to the metro and terrific sights, excellent breakfast and friendly staff. The Bad is; the elevator kept breaking down and was out of commission during 4 of the 8 nights we stayed. 4 flights up and down gets very tideous expecially after a long day of walking the city. It seemed that the elevator breaking down is a regular happening there. Actually, a woman got stuck in the elevator inbetween the 4th and 5th floor for about 40 minutes. Good thing she wasn't clostraphobic because this elevator is tiny. Also, the air conditioning in our room wasn't working the last night we were there. They didn't take anything off our bill for the inconvienences. The Ugly; was the mold growing on top of the bathroom walls. Would I stay there again? Yes, if I could make sure my room was on the 1st floor. The rooms are clean, the breakfast coffee and crossants are great and the location is lively and centrally located. Our room was relatively quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hit home in the first strike - Good Hotel, Great Location, Complete Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Mamta653
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 4 days in July 2008 and have to say, we struck gold on our first visit to Paris!! Having heard of varying recounts of dingy hotels, miniscule bathrooms in all european hotels, we were pleaseantly surprised and happy with our choice in Paris. The hotel is quaint in its looks and furnishings being very edwardian but is complete and utter value for money. The rooms are miniature doll houses in their furniture and welcome furnishings. Decent sized bathrooms, great service - we got a room change as our room's a/c was'nt working - great breakfast. The Hotel location is the crowning glory - it is 5-7 min walk from Louvre, station and all the central sites. A must stay for all planning a trip to paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: eurolady28
Reviews.Content: Convenience location, charming room with lots of storage and modern bathroom. Breakfast was very good, however the room is very small and if you are not there early you will end up waiting for a table. Free internet access in lobby. Metro stop is about a block away and if you are taking the Eurostar it is a direct line from/to the hotel stop.

Reviews.Title: “small room, but convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cayman8
Reviews.Content: This Best Western has apparently lost its "Premier" status, although I'm not sure why it ever would have had that appellation. We reserved a room that was not the smallest that the hotel had to offer, but was nonetheless, pretty small. The bathroom was clean and modern and the closet space adequate. All in all, for as close in as the hotel is, and for the price (roughly 145 Euro/night), I had no serious reservations about the hotel. The a/c was a bit of a problem, in that it did not cool the room sufficiently during daylight hours in late August. But then, the small room was primarily a sleeping space. The continental breakfast was limited, but adequate. Anyone expecting something even remotely approaching an American breakfast would be disappointed. There were no hot items available, simply two kinds of lunchmeat, two types of cheese, some hard boiled eggs and toast. I was disappointed that no pastries were included - it was Paris, after all - but the basket of breads brought to the table did have a good variety, including one croissant each morning with what appeared to be chocolate chips. The staff of the hotel was efficient and helpful. Overall, this hotel is a good place to stay for convenience and price, if one is not wed to having a large room and spacious public area.

Reviews.Title: “A great Parisian hotel with reliable international branding in a great Parisian location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMarc
Reviews.Content: My wife and two year old daugther and I just returned from a quick 5 day/ 4 night stay in Paris that was memorable in large part because of the BW Left Bank. As has been oft repeated in the reviews here the location is superb. You're in the heart of St. Germain, just south of the Quartier Latin, and a pleasant walk from Ile de la Cite and even the Louvre. When it came to dining we never had to venture very far. Our days began with the very generous and statisfying included breakfast at the hotel. Our days ended with meals at the many different restaurants in the immediate area. On the hotel side of Boulevard St. Germain, just up the road from the hotel we ate at Alcazar which was an excellent Parisian brasserie with a modern touch and also at Le Procope, also a brasserie but more traditional in style, which is literally next to the hotel. On the other side of the Boulevard we ate at Les Editeurs and the Horse's Tavern. Of the four I'd have to say that the best was Les Editeurs. We also wanted to try Le Comptoir across from Les Editeurs but it's a veritable dining hot spot with local folks lined up out the door waiting for one of the restaurants few tables every night we were there. I suspect it would have claimed top spot had we been able to partake. There's an excellent boulangerie across from the hotel and Carrefour market just up the road and around the corner where we could stock up on water, juice, fruits, cheese and pretty much everything else. It was a great place to put together picnic lunches that we enjoyed in the Luxembourg and Tuileries gardens. The Odeon metro stop is a super short walk away and can take you East-West on the 10 (which is a direct line to the Tour Eiffel) and North-South on the 4 which can bring you directly and quickly to Montparnasee or Chatelet/Les Halles from which you can easily connect to virtually all of Paris. From the two metro lines you can directly reach three of Paris' large train stations: Gare du Nord (which goes to the main Roissy airport), Gare de l'Est and Gare d'Austerlitz. Taking all that in to consideration the location of the hotel is superb. The staff were very cordial and the rooms were traditionally appointed. We had a standard Rue de l'Ancienne facing room and as has been said here, the lively evening street sound was never a noise problem. The bathroom was standard size. Space wise mentally prepare for smaller European living dimensions relative to North American hotels. As much as I try to do so, I seem to always be a little taken aback at the living space adjustment. Still, all in all a highly reccomended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Locatiopn.”
Reviews.Author: ucmedaa.
Reviews.Content: Excellent quiet clean hotel and in a great location. I booked two rooms in this hotel for myself, wife and married daughter late August '09 for three nights. Both were at the front, both were very clean, spacious bathrooms, and plenty of room to move around. Tea and coffee making facilities available on request and kept well stocked each day by the cleaning lady. I picked this hotel because I am partially disabled and in this respect it was brilliant. Metro less than one hundred metres away on the traffic island on St Germain, taxi rank a bit less and a netwotk of small narrow streets full of eateries of all sorts to right of front door. Carrefour well stocked supermarket about 100 metres to right of front door. Air conditioning works, rooms are quiet and the windows open. Staff were efficient and generally the whole place was well maintained. Breakfast was excellent as a continental breakfast and it was a no skimping eat what you like policy. I would use it again and would recommend it as an excellent hotel. Book through the Best Western website for the best prices. But a word of warning, be absolutely certain taxi driver knows exactly where you are going and tell driver very firmly to stop if he looks like driving past your stop point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy hotel with friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Nico_Van_de_Venne
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel has graspt my appatite. It's simple but efficient, simple buffet breakfast. Good clean rooms (excellent bathroom). The location is Prime no better location in my experience, I make 2 to 2:30 hour walks from the hotel in the evening and when I come back there are still enough restaurents and bars to go to in the area. The reception has several different people and several different moods, could be dependant of the tourist or business man/woamn that comes before you :-). I'm always frinedly to people even if they are in a bad mood en that has brought a lot of frutfull thngs to me like free koffie before check-in (when dropping of my luggage in the morning before going to my client). Good hotel when you just like the basics and nu fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: wanttogobacksoon
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this hotel with our children, ages 10 and 16. The room was not huge but was very clean and the beds were quite comfortable. Despite being somewhat small, the bathroom was very modern with a nice tub and shower. Breakfast was fine, served by friendly staff. There is a bakery across the street to get croissants for the day, as well. The concierge recommended the Roger et Grenouille restaurant which was nearby, very good and quite French! Paris is a fabulous city and this hotel was perfectly located within walking distance of many sites, restaurants and nightlife and near the Metro, RER, and Bateaubus for further excursions .

Reviews.Title: “great location, little smaller than expected, but worked out fine”
Reviews.Author: palagitoi
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff spoke english well enough to get us on our way. Housekeeping was always outstanding. Furniture a little out dated, but it was functional. The mini bar was a small fridge with bottled water, candy and juice. NO PARKING! But there is parking down the street about 50 meters. Haggle to get a deal there. Wonderful cafes and restaurants in the area. By far the cheapest eats around as you are in the Center of the Latin Quarter. Its a University town so street performers, bars and a night life is to be had. Saying that our room was in the front and we were not woken by any noise. Would stay again when visiting Paris with family. Breakfast was continental, so rolled meats, cheese, breads, juice and coffee. Good way to start the day with food in the belly.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jmarie13
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 6 nights and found the hotel and room small but quite pleasant. The atmosphere was exactly what we wanted for a Left Bank stay. Our 3d floor room was tight with 4 beds, but not uncomfortable. The staff were pleasant and helpful for the most part, especially Lorette and Robert. They spoke English and did not laugh at our tries at French. The evening clerk for a couple of the nights was very reserved and could not offer much help in selecting places to eat. We arranged for van shuttles from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport. Reading comments here raised a few questions but both worked wonderfully. Breakfast was good and served in a pleasant area off the lobby. The lobby was elegant and welcoming. Free, fast WiFi/internet was definite plus (as during the next part of our trip the more starred hotels charged a fee for a slow connection). The location is terrific. Many tourists of all sorts (which could be considered a plus or a minus depending on your view). The area was very busy in the early evening at all the cafes and restaurants. Close to Metro and RER. Walking around the area was one of the best parts of the trip. I would recommend this hotel for a good experience getting to know Paris.

Reviews.Title: “How Did this hotel get such a great rating?”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a disappointment. The good news is great location. The bad is the room condition and the service. Our room had spider webs and was somewhat dank. The beds were from the dark ages. The breakfast was plain and did not compare to our other three hotels on this trip. By far our worst hotel this last trip. That said, we may have been stuck in their back room due to us being a family. Additionally in the fairness of full disclosure, we tend to like really nice hotels. If you're not a family and you're out and about all the time the location would make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location With Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Baidun
Reviews.Content: Quite a gem very close to main attractions, the Odeon Metro and metres from great restaurants and bars. We carried our 1 year old outside in his pyjamas to listen to the evening street music outside a cafe next door. Inside the rooms had no street noise and were clean. Furnishings were attractiive traditional Parisian and somehow they squeezed a cot into our standard room (too small for a family staying more than 2 nights). Very friendly and helpful reception, good value for a 3-star hotel, including free fast internet. Beware there are many Best Western hotels in Paris, the one nearby at St Michel also seems to be referred to as the Left Bank hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Pariesian elegance in a traditional prime St. Germain setting!”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood of St Germain des Pres in Paris' 6th arrondissement is one of the most typically Parisian and most often adored by tourists and locals alike. In the very heart of this neighborhood, the Best Western Premier Left Bank is an upscale version of old Paris, with a style of history and traditional elegance. The rooms were tastefully furnished in charming style, with floral prints and wooden beams as the norm. Rooms in this part of Paris are rarely large, and these are no different; but spacious enough, given the high charm factor. The lobby is beautiful, including much stonework on the walls and tapestries that look centuries-old! Outside, the cafes of Hemingway and Victor Hugo await!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel in the St. Germain district”
Reviews.Author: starwatch
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed five nights in this Best Western hotel in the St. Germain district. The front desk staff were courteous and spoke excellent English. The hotel rate includes breakfast - basket of croissants and baquette, toast, juice, cereal, cheese, coffee, tea or hot chocolate. The room was clean and the two beds were comfortable with down pillows. We had room 404 - large by Paris standards. The room was very quiet - no street noise. I would most definitely stay in this hotel again. The location is ideal if you love the St. Germain area with its shops, restaurants, and lively night scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevejdc
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many other 3 star hotels in Paris, but this was the best. It is a very nice little hotel with clean and quiet rooms and excellent service. Most important, the rooms aren't postage stamp size. The location is perfect for sightseeing. It's also nice that they have a computer available for free internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Parisian in good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lynny07
Reviews.Content: Stands tall on a narrow corner 2 blocks "left" of the Seine and Notre Dame. Small rooms typical of Paris, french doors to handkerchief size balcony, efficient but tiny lift, and helpful staff who contacted EuroDisney to arrange return of my credit cards I had left with an inexperienced receptionist. Travelling with my sister and niece, we chose breakfast and dining opportunities in the neighbourhood so cannot comment on hotel meals. Clean, well presented, friendly staff and excellent location near shops, restaurants, the underground, the Seine and Notre Dame with the Louvre not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful... and then horrible”
Reviews.Author: sg664
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. Room was compfortable and provided a nice continental breakfast. Hotel is in a good location close to museums, monuments, cafes, etc. All the staff we'd dealt with until the morning we left had been ver y nice. We were therefore shocked when the hotel so completely mishandled our shuttle arrangements the morning we departed We had requested shuttle service to the airport in advance and paid 16 euro down payment to the hotel. We specifically asked the hotel's desk attendant that morning (6:00 a.m.) if the taxi van across the street was for us. He checked a book to confirm we had made shuttle arrangements and then told us that that was our shuttle. But when we got to the airport and tried to pay the additional 20 euro per the shuttle voucher, the driver didn't know what we were talking about and demanded an additional 50 euro. We called the hotel to sort out the issue but the new desk attendant screamed at us, took no responsibility for their error, refused to at least pay the driver the 16 euro we had already paid the hotel and then hung up on us. The handling of this issue was incredibly rude and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: TrippingTexan
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Best Western Left Bank. My wife and two teenage daughters spent two nights. We had some difficulty finding a hotel in Paris that could accommodate four people in one room, but Room 06 at the BW Left Bank fit the bill. Room 06 had a nice Parisian feel, especially after having spent four nights at the Le Meridien Montparnasse which was more of an American style hotel. Room 06 was on the first floor and very close to the front desk and the breakfast area. It was very quiet. The room had three permanent beds (two put together to create the equivalent of a queen size bed and one twin size bed built into an alcove against the wall). The fourth bed was a portable bed that was brought in. The room also had a desk and chair. As a result there was not much floor space left but it was more than sufficient since we did not spend much time in the room. The bathroom was very large for a Paris hotel with a marble floor and vanity. It had a bath tub with a hand held shower head with an attachment on the wall for a hands-free shower (no shower curtain however). A breakfast buffet was included in the price of the room and open from 7-10am. It was more than sufficient... basket of breads/croissants, meats, cheeses, toast, yogurt, fruit, cereals, coffee, juices. The location was excellent. It was just a few steps from St Germain Blvd and its numerous brasseries/cafes/shops and the Odean metro stop. It was a bit tricky finding Rue de l'Ancienne Comédie coming out of the Odean stop the first time since there are a number of streets that come together at this point on St Germain Blvd. But we eventually found it. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Notre Dame. The service (front desk and breakfast attendant) was understated and reserved. All of our requests were met and questions answered sufficiently. The only negatives were the hot water ran out the second night when our daughters were taking showers, the shower did not have a curtain so the floor got a bit wet when showering, and the mattresses were a bit firmer than I would have preferred. While BW Left Bank was a bit more than we initially planned to spend, overall I would give it two thumbs up. Especially Room 06 for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of hotel, encompassing all elements Paris should leave you with...”
Reviews.Author: C_K83
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after very careful consideration, since we were staying in Paris for 4 nights. The location won me over at first since i used to leave in paris and i knew the area was great. Indeed the hotel is at an amazing location (Odeon) which gives easy access to the whole of Paris. The hotel itself has a lovely baroque atmosphere yet not heavy, which instantly makes you feel the Parisian atmosphere. The rooms have a distinct character and are very well kept with newly fitted bathrooms. Very spacious storage and excellent double-glazing windows completely sound-proof, which is greatly appreciated given the hotel's busy location. The rooms are super clean and the stuff is very helpful and patient with tourists! Breakfast is pretty good and above all it's served until 11am! The cherry on the cake is the amazing perfume of clean the sheets and towels, something rare for medium-budget hotels. I would without any hesitation recommend this hotel to everyone who wants a real experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Pet1276
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Left bank and loved the service and location. Funny Desquesnes, Frank and the staff were delightful. The rooms were very well arranged and plenty of storage and the bathroom was beautiful. Some reviews stated that the street side rooms were noisy but we could not hear anything from our room overlooking the street but there was some construction at the hotel but Funny was very accommodating on this issue. We ate lunch and dinner within a two block area of the hotel. The Salad Restaurant in the alley behind the hotel was great. The decor was beautiful and the breakfast was good. I would stay there again. The St. Germain district was so much fun to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: muddsmom
Reviews.Content: Because of some great airfares, we decided on a last minute long weekend to Paris. We have visited Paris numerous times and love the 6th Arrondissement, (St-Germain/Luxembourg.) I had several hotels in mind, but settled on the Hotel Left Bank, which offered some great rates. This hotel belongs to the Best Western chain, but you won't find anything resembling what we think of with this chain in the US. It's located at 9 rue de l'Ancienne Comedie, which is near the very popular intersection of several streets which join together, where there are numerous cafe's, restaurants and stores for fresh breads and pastries. The hotel is small and very charming. The people working at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but the norm for Paris and the bathroom had a full bathtub with the hand held shower which could be attached to hang overhead. The room was clean with a queen bed, desk and chair, wardrobe and small refrigerator with the TV sitting on top. The bed linens were crisp and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is also equiped with WiFi. Our room overlooked the main street, which was pretty noisy all night long if you opened the window, but when it was closed, you couldn't hear a thing. Our only complaint was that the room was pretty warm and we really needed to open the window for cooler air at times, but couldn't sleep once the window was open. We were there the first week in March, so this may not be a problem during other months or you should ask for a room at the back of the hotel. The breakfast was pretty norm for most European hotels, but the breakfast room was very nice and the lady working there made sure we had coffee, tea and fresh breads. There were also hard boiled eggs, cheese and meats, along with cereal. You can ask for scrambled eggs, but will pay extra for them. We would stay at this hotel again and feel you simply can't beat the location. It's only a block from the Odeon Metro Station and you can walk to almost everything, and we did.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank Best Western: Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: wheeltravelerToronto
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Best Western on the Left Bank. We looked for days on line for a room that provided wheelchair access and would accommodate 3 people. Almost all hotels required that we rent a second room which would have made our already expensive stay in Paris even more so. The Left Band hotel provided a triple room with wheelchair access for 240 Euros. First, the highlights. This hotel is ideally located, minutes from Notre Dame, the Louvre, the banks of the Seine and in the middle of small streets filled with sidewalk cafes, art stores and boutiques--a quintessentially Parisian experience. The hotel does not at all recall the hotel chain of North America; rather, it looks like a small Parisian boutique hotel. The breakfast included with the price was provided in a small cozy room. We enjoyed the breakfast and appreciated the service provided by the women responsible for this aspect of the hotel's hospitality. The bedroom and bathroom were both very large and comfortable by European standards. The room was dark with only one window opening to a small outside area that was not accessible to guests; however, its location on the ground floor was very quiet. A word of warning for those in wheelchairs traveling by themselves, although the hotel is billed as wheelchair accessible, there is a step to enter the building and the room's bathroom though spacious is not built to barrier free design specifications. The beds are too low for easy transfer to and from the wheelchair. In all, however, I found that with only minor assistance from my husband, the access was not too bad. The only real problem we had with the hotel is the unfriendly staff at the desk. The staff were not actually rude, but neither were they proactive with advice or even with greetings. When we checked in, the man at the desk continued to talk on the phone for several minutes before acknowledging us. We were never greeted on leaving or returning to the hotel. They never asked if our room was comfortable, or if we were happy with the room. When we checked out we asked for information to the bus stop heading to the train station and the information provided was wrong. It sent us in the opposite direction and as a result we missed our train back to England. Perhaps this cool, indifferent service is typical of Parisian hospitality, but it contrasts unfavourably with the experience we had in English hotels and left us with an overall unfavourable impression of the hotel and to some extent, it coloured our experience of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: eurotravelerMissouri
Reviews.Content: We just spent several nights at this wonderful little hotel in a fabulous neighborhood in Paris. The rooms were charming and quiet. It is located on a somewhat busy street but is as quiet as can be. The employees were all very helpful and friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the treatment we received. The breakfast was excellent and with the prices in Paris, a very good deal. We loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “loved this area and paris”
Reviews.Author: fiz67
Reviews.Content: my friend and i decided on a girlie trip to paris 3 nights, we chose this hotel as we had stayed in a best western in york england. we travelled via eurostar from london, we absolutley loved the area surrouding this hotel is was very easy to get to also from the station the eurostar arrives at just one metro about 6 stops. we were greeted by a very friendly gent at reception we were told we had been upgraded and were in room 106 (not sure why) this was at the back of the hotel and was very very quiet. we even over slept the first morning coz the curtains were so dark and it was so quiet. just a few yards away from the hotel going away from the boulavard at a little cross roads are some narrow roads full of life - bars restaurants cake shops art gallerys and such like. plus on a road off these is a very useful supermarket where you can get stocked up on water or snacks and even the odd bottle of fizzy, there was a mini bar in our room but we only used it for storage you can fit a couple of large wine bottles in with your water. on our first night we ate at alkazar just up the road we had pre booked this from england. it was lovely, very smart but not too posh you felt odd, it was more expensive than the restaurants in that area its owed by terrance conran i reccommend it for a treat we paid 140 euros for two, there are loads of little bistros in the area though that do fixed price 3 course for as little as 12 euros so you can easily eat cheaply which we did too. on our second nite we ate at the st germain bistro on rue de buci i think someone on here has posted a picture of it we paid 17 euros and it was very nice and friendly. room upstairs too if it looks full. we had drinks before and after in the local bars. the third night we went for an italian called ceaser pizza it was fine, a little cramped ok if your not too bothered about knocking elbows with strangers could even make the night more interesting the waiters are a cheeky lot too. i thought all these bars restaurants and "life" where a god send after days sight seeing and travelling on the metro we really didn't want to go far to eat at night. just a few tips - if you are decding on a boat trip they leave near there at the notra dame about a 15min walk up river away forn the louvre its a round trip going past the eiffel tower and back again 12 euros, tickets lasts all day hop on and off etc and if you decide on a hop on and off bus tour the tickets are expensive at 24 euros but last two days so buy it in plenty if time. we were going to do this on last day but didn't realise they were for two days. so didn't bother. we did seem to spend a lot of time on the metro and it would have been nice to see more day light so to speak. there are plenty of banks surrounding the hotel with cash machines too. the breakfast in the hotel in served till 11am so it great if you have had a heavy night and with some of the bars having excellent cocktail menus you may well do ,we had a few champagne cocktials that were to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Best Western Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SashaTexas
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at another Best Western in Paris I hoped for a good experience at the Best Western Left Bank - St. Germain. I read reviews on this site and chose the hotel accordingly. My overall experience was good. The room was quite clean, the bathroom was clean, the location was terrific, the breakfast was included in the price so that was a great value, the staff was fine. The bed was comfortable, the sheets were crisp and clean, the towels were plentiful. I was in room 202 directly facing the street so there was noise from the lively crowd below, which stayed hopping until 1 or 2 am. The location is terrific. The hotel is steps away from Rue du Buci so there were plenty of cafes for meals and several boulangeries for quick croissants and cookies. Several clothing boutiques and decor shops were close by. Without even having to go just steps away to Blvd St Germain all the unique things about Paris could be had in the one block surrounding the hotel. So the location was above average. No need to discuss the size of the room because everyone knows Paris hotels are tiny. There was a desk and two chairs and two people could sleep and move in the room just fine. The hair dryer in the room is the kind attached to the wall with one hose you pull out to dry hair. No heat or speed choices, just hot air. But it worked well and hair looked just fine. Water pressure in the shower was great and plenty hot. The company the hotel arranges airport transport with was late, directionally challenged, and unaware of the airport terminals but the problem wasn't with the hotel. Overall a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: virginiatraveler00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel during our last night in Paris and I have to admit the experience of staying in this great little hotel was lost on us a little. The hotel is in the middle of a high traffic area with lots of sights to see, people watching, cool stores, etc., but we wanted mostly sleep at that point. The room was very comfortable, with great beds and bedding. The service was good. I would just warn potential guests that there is a lot of street noise here, but overall worth the noise for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjones512
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending 6 nights at this hotel to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. I have stayed in a handful of very cheap hotels in Paris over the years and although not exactly cheap this hotel was a such a pleasant surprise. We had an inside room with a window opening out onto a beautiful atrium. Although small, as most hotel rooms are in Paris, our room was very quaint with period furnishings and a nice big comfy queen bed. The bathroom was more modern than I expected and detailed in marble. I think what surprised me most was how incredibly quiet it was in our room. Although the hotel was full we hardly ever heard another guest. The continental breakfast is plenty sufficient and nicely presented and we LOVED the fact that breakfast was served until 10:30am! The location is also great being right in the middle of it all in the Latin Quarter and just across the street from a metro stop. Plenty of restaurants, shops, ice cream and even Starbucks all within arms reach. I think the only negative thing I can say is that the lighting in both the bedroom and especially the bathroom was very, very dim. Girls, if you need light to put on your makeup then think about taking your own lighted makeup mirror. Loved it and will definitely book this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KiloTango
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in 2 rooms for 4 nights and this turned out to be a perfect hotel. While the rooms are somewhat cramped (as you would expect) the location is what makes this hotel special. This is only about a half-block from the Metro-Odeon station but on a lightly-traveled side street that remains relatively quiet (we did have interior rooms). At the same time, within one or two blocks are literally dozens of restaurants and cafes of all types that offer great food at modest (for Paris) prices. We were amazed to find just a half block over on Rue de Buci five or six cafes fully occupied at 10:00pm on a Thursday, with the street crowded entertainers and passers-by. Not rowdy, just lively! Later in our stay we found that continuing on south on Rue saint-andre de arts down to Saint MIchael continued this lively street scene. The hotel itself is comfortable with no particular complaints. There are only about five rooms per floor on five floors, so it isnt particuarly busy, except when trying to get the elevator down when checking out in the morning. The only problem we had was when my wife turned on one of the lights it blew a fuse. When we reported it the next morning it was fixed by the time we returned. The breakfast is included and offers a small buffet, along with rolls and hot drinks served to the tables. This actually becomes a plus when you consider the cost of alternatives (with kids) and the time it would take to go elsewhere. Finally, of all the hotels we stayed at on our vacation, this one had the best smelling sheets. Not overwhelming, mind you, but a subtle scent of something floral that was just...nice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Reception”
Reviews.Author: Joueur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed at this hotel 19 years ago during part of our honeymoon. During our return stay there this year with our son, the lady at the front desk, Lorette, was exceedingly accomodating and helpful and gracious in every way. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere of the left bank cafes and restaurants and will always feel grateful for the hospitality at this hotel in large part due to Lorette.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: TrixieWoof
Reviews.Content: Bonjour! My husband and I and two teenage boys just returned from a four day stay at the BW ST. G. We had a mixed experience--the location is fabulous, the street scene charming and wonderful, and the hotel is mixed. The baths were great--renovated, clean and lovely, with fabulous hot water, towels, and toiletries. The beds were very comfortable with great linens and pillows. Rooms are so small it is almost painful: I had to wait to pack until my husband was finished as the space near the closet and bureau was too small for two people. I guess this is typical for Paris. Decor was dark and felt oppressive. Breakfast was ok--not great. Plastic wrapped cheese, no whole grains, canned fruit. Eggs to order for a few euros was a great option. Coffee and oj were good, and in Paris, breakfast is rarely included so this was great for us. Our boys loved the crepe shop two doors away and ate crepes every day! The common spaces are too small to sit in very much--much more of a B & B than a hotel. One PC terminal in the lobby, not free, but free wifi at a cafe almost next door if you bring a laptop. The staff were very disappointing. I do speak some French, but they often spoke too fast for me to follow and were annoyed when I switched to English or asked them to repeat themselves. We had a serious misunderstanding about a tour we wanted to take--they booked us with a company that they said "we use" rather than a company that we wanted that offered decidedly different tours, via a Segway. Obviously, they misunderstood us, but "bike" and "segway" are very different. While they refunded our deposit, this illustrates the weakness of their English. When I needed to cancel a lunch reservation, they gave me the phone number rather than offering to do this for me. Maybe this is too much to expect of a Best Western?
