They were also unfamiliar with the "velib" program, a bike pick up and drop off program in Paris that requires a French based credit card. When I asked about picking up a bike, they said to use a credit card. Later I learned (from another hotel) that one needs a french credit card. How could they not know this? This is not a small matter in a tourist city. My feeling is that the hotel needs a concierge, and the front desk attempts to function as one, but is weak on English, annoyed at being overwhelmed by guests, and undertrained. However, the basics (cleanliness, linens, coffee, baths) are solid. The area is fabulous, and as one always walks in Paris, other reviews that complain about the location are wanting to be in the monuments area, arrondisement #1. It worked for us, and one does not go to Paris for the hotel, so thanks to the fabulous local street scene, with shops, musicians, crepes, cafes, and more, we had a great time. Would we go back? Not without looking into other options. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: aggietcu
Reviews.Content: We were generally disappointed with the room, staff, and location of the hotel. The room was very small, dark, and shabby. The staff was extremely cold and, on many occassions, we were not even greeted when we came through the door. Breakfast was disappointing - guarded by the "breakfast nazi". The closest subway station requires transfers several times to reach the major tourist sites. The location in Latin Quarter was good for dining out at night. We had several excellent meals close to the hotel. If you are an inexperienced traveler needing extensive help from the front desk, you are out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “C'est super! A gem in the heart of St. Germain.”
Reviews.Author: madamekyle
Reviews.Content: J'adore cet hotel! It is a shame that this hotel is not listed in any of the guidebooks. It is fabulous. I am picky about the little things (linens, beds) but I have to say there were no negatives for me here. Keep in mind that in Europe the rooms in hotels are much smaller than in the United States unless you stay at a very pricey place--like the Ritz (and even then, you cannot be sure it will be that big). So here are the best things about this hotel: 1) It's CLEAN. You could eat off the floor. 2) COMFORTABLE: the beds were firm but soft and felt new. The linens were also soft and I wasn't too warm or too cold. 3) The bathroom is pretty big for European standards and has a hair dryer in the room. They gave us extra towels each day and I only asked once. The shower gels smell good and the shower is very strong with a lot of hot water (this is a luxury in Europe). 4) It's an airconditioned hotel--another luxury in Europe. 5) BREAKFAST! I love their petit dejeuner. You can order eggs for a few euros extra but the rest if included in your room price. The Madame who runs the breakfast speaks fluent English and will get you anything--all while keeping the area spotless. They will bring you bread/croissants, coffee and you can choose from cereal, yogurt, salami and ham and muffins. I really looked forward to getting up. 6) The front desk staff is wonderful. All speak English fluently and go out of their way to be friendly and helpful. They'll make any call you need. Of the most help is the quiet, reserved but ultra efficient and intelligent Franck. Franck will very calmly do what you need him to do. also emailed the hotel directly a few times before I left with general questions and he wrote me back within a few hours. Merci, Franck!! Vous etes tres sympa!! 7) LOCATION: I was not thrilled with Paris' transportation system. The buses are hard to use, taxis do not exist and the metro is, well..........you just better move fast because it's like NYC. So we walked a lot. This hotel is near everything. You can easily walk to all the museums and get over into the Right Bank. The St. Germain neighborhood is so quaint and there are a lot of places to eat. On one street over is (Rue Gregoire) is this fabulous cafe called the St. Germain Cafe (look for Gabriel in the entrance asking you to come in; take him up on it and order the French onion soup) and a few steps away is a yellow building with crepes...........amazing crepes! 8) It's QUIET. You won't hear a thing in other rooms and you can't hear the noise outside. It was so quiet that on the morning I forget a wakeup call, we ended up sleeping until 11:00. And that is way late in St. Germain. As a city, Paris was difficult for me. It was too big, too crowded and reminded me of New York, and je n'aime pas New York. So I looked forward each evening to returning to this hotel, where I could take a hot shower, get into bed, read my guidebooks and watch Law & Order in French. Merci beaucoup, St. Germain!!!!!!!!!!!!! You were the highlight of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: CLCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the Left Bank off Rue Buci, this Best Western Hotel has uncomfortable and very small rooms, even by European standards. Rooms that are "05" as in "105", "205" are billed as Queen Superior Rooms but are exceedingly small for two people. Only a small public space in the hotel to relax (don't be fooled by the hotel photo). More price friendly than some of its counterparts in the area, but at 270 euros, we think we could have done better. Best part of the hotel is its location which is just off the St. Germain and Rue Buci with its great brasseries and food shops.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Pam_David
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem in the heart of Paris. Let's first talk about location -- it is around the corner from the Metro, in the heart of St. Germain (fabulous restaurants), and a few (very few) minutes walk to Louvre, the Seine, Notre Dame, and the Pantheon. Now, let's talk breakfast -- it was good. Cheeses, breads, jams, coffee, and tea. Nothing spectacular, but took place in a cozy atmosphere that made it seem special. The rooms themselves were rather large for European standards. I was really surprised. The bathroom was incredibly "American" -- another surprise. I was afraid that staying at a Best Western would be sterile and ubiquitous. But, it wasn't at all. They seemed to have a romantic air about them. Lastly, we should tell you about the staff. At times, I found them to be a bit cold. They seemed disturbed every time we showed up to be let in at night. However, they did go above and beyond. My husband asked me to marry him in Paris. While we were out getting engaged, the desk staff bought flowers for our room per his request and had them there to suprise me.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the minute we arrived. The lobby decor is lovely -- welcoming and cozy -- with many paintings and tapestries giving it an "Old Europe" feel. We had arrived early, expecting to simply stow our luggage and return later. However, our room was ready, so we were able to check in immediately. The staff at the front desk were professional and efficient -- not overly warm, but always courteous. They do speak English, but we tried to use French as much as possible. They were very helpful (and tolerant!) with our attempts. Our room was very attractive and quiet, looking out onto an interior courtyard garden. The room was immaculately clean, although it was slightly stuffy. The beds were comfortable -- most welcome after a long day of travel or sightseeing! The room had a large flat-screen TV, mini-bar, and an in-room safe. The bathroom was modern and relatively spacious, and was stocked with nice toiletries. Breakfasts were ample and there was a nice selection of croissants, rolls, cereal, yogurt, ham, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, fruit, OJ, robust coffee, tea, and hot chocolate The server was sweet and attentive. The location of this hotel is absolutely outstanding! The metro, RER, taxis, and buses are all convenient. In the neighborhood (indeed right outside the door!) are innumerable restaurants, bars, bakeries, and shops. The Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame -- to name but a few -- are all within comfortable walking distance. Saint Germain is a lively area, bustling with activity, and we felt very safe walking around at night. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel, very accomodating staff, in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LovesSunnyIsles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this lovely small hotel many times in recent years: by myself; with my husband; with my (grown) daughter; and with friends. We have recommended it, as well, to many of our friends who have also become "regulars". It is a charming small property in a fabulous location. The rooms are very comfortable, with modern bathrooms. The staff has always been welcoming & extremely helpful. (They even stored my luggage, after I had checked out to visit friends outside Paris but was going to be returning to this hotel after a long weekend.) The location is just up the street from the Odeon Metro, which is very convenient - and I can also walk from here to many of the places I tend to visit. My only hesitation in writing a rave review is that I'm reluctant to let too many people know about one of my favorite places to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: addisonite
Reviews.Content: Just returned and had to post. What a charming and cozy hotel. We stayed in a quad room with a 9 and 12 yr. old. It appeared newly updated, very clean(and I'm fussy), and cozy. European rooms in these small places are of course smaller than home but the bathroom was quite large, new and clean!!! A breakfast is included in a cute and cozy dning room. They served fresh breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, hard boiled eggs, yogurts, juice, coffee and canned fruit. That was the only thing we really didn't care for. They could have put out fresh fruit instead. Oh well, if that is the only thing to complain about, I'll take it. Location...Awesome!!! Loads of restaurants, cafes, bakeries, stores and more. Walking less than a block to the Metro. Notre Dame and the Seine a quick walk. We walked just about everywhere mostly and it is a Great Walking City! Overall not a cheap place to stay, but well worth the money for a family of four. Very Happy! Note: They even let us keep the room till 1pm due to our departure time, even though the checkout was 12pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: TeoMilano
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice surprise. The location is great both for shopping and for visiting the main tourist places. My room was cosy, of course not a five star hotel room, but very clean. The bathroom was small, but nice and clean! Breakfast was ok! The hotel is only two blocks away from Saint Germain des Pres, where there are many great bistrots! I definetely would go again!

Reviews.Title: “update on the left bank st. germain”
Reviews.Author: holly01
Reviews.Content: Update on the Left Bank St. Germain - Be aware of what kind of room you are booking and how you book it - either through Best Western or the hotel. We have stayed at this hotel 3 other times in the past couple of years. The very last time we stayed there was Nov. 22-24 with some friends that were visiting from the states. I had also just previously been there 2 weeks prior to that (Nov. 7-9) with my mom and daughter. For both occasions, I had booked and requested the same triple room (604) through the hotel (Lorette handled the booking). On the Nov. 7 trip, we were given that room. It's a room that I've stayed in before. Very nice with 3 separate beds and windows that look out over the street on one side and the other towards Notre Dame. When I checked out of the hotel on the 9th - I confirmed with Lorette that we were getting the same triple room on the 22nd. When we arrived on the night of the 22nd, this triple room had "magically" been transformed into a suite and was not available for us. I reminded Lorette that I had confirmed this room in the initial booking and then again just 2 weeks earlier, but she said that the room they had given us then was, in fact, a suite - and that I was just unaware of it. The room that WAS available for us was a dark "dungeon" room with 2 small windows. Yes, it had 3 beds, but it was very cramped and cold. After I saw this room, I went back to discuss with Lorette - who made no apologies - just that the room we thought we were getting was now really a suite and unavailble - unless, of course, we wanted to pay over 400 euros. So much for honesty and customer appreciation. When I was checking out on the 24th, I spoke with a couple who had just arrived and were waiting for their room in the lobby. They had booked through Best Western and received one of the larger triple rooms for a much lower price than what we got for the "dungeon". 2 lessons learned - First - we, personally, will never go back to this hotel. Second - if we book again at a chain hotel - never, never book through the hotel directly. I've always booked through hotels directly in the past and received good service (and better rates, usually). This is not the case anymore. One more side note that should have given me a heads up - for what's it's worth. On Nov. 9, before my departure from the hotel, I had inadvertently left my hat in the downstairs bathroom of the hotel. When I got to the train station at 2:00 p.m., I realized that I had left it and called the hotel. The man who answered at the reception said they were too busy to look for it and that I should call back at 6:00 p.m. Needless to say, by the time they got around to it, the hat was gone. I wish I didn't have to give this hotel such a bad review. It used to be really a nice place to stay in a great location, and there are a number of employees who work there who are very nice and really try to accomodate. Unfortunately, a couple of "bad apples" have spoiled the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family room in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TVC15mk
Reviews.Content: Best Western Left Bank is a great hotel with a perfect location for all excursions in Paris and surroundings. St Germain is THE arrondisment to stay in when in Paris. Easy access to Metro and RER, walking distance to many of the main tourist attractions, a multitude of restaurants of all kinds and classes and great shopping - all on top of a relaxed atmosphere in the student quartier. The hotel is clean and quiet with friendly and helpsam staff. We stayed in a (for Paris) spacious four bed room - perfect for familiies. The breakfast which was included in the price was delicious, including the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Loves-Paris
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel, having stayed here in September 2006. In a city as large and as full-service as Paris, I think it says something about a property when you want to come back for a second time. The location, breakfast, and helpful staff just can't be beat. When booking, I requested a room with a view of the street: no problem. More entertaining than looking onto the courtyard... The windows are glazed and solid, so street noise is never an issue. Bathrooms are clean, well stocked, and come w/ hair dryer. Breakfast is hearty. But above all, it's the location that is the draw here. The price is a bit steep and cheaper Paris hotels can be found..... But for consistent quality and a stone's throw from everything, its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Left Bank hotel”
Reviews.Author: born2critique
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute and paid a very high rate for a Best Western-the hotel did not disappoint. Our room was charming-with exposed timber and high ceilings-double paned glass kept most of the noise from the Rugby revellers at bay. They were very helpful -after a 12 hour flight we arrived at the hotel at 10:30a.m.-I had a small child with me- the receptionist told me our room would be ready around 2p.m.-but also said go have a coffee and come back. By 11a.m. we were in our room! The morning continental breakfast was good-and the lady in the breakfast room happy to make my daughter a hot chocolate in the morning. The reception staff are fabulous at concierge duties-and happy to arrange tours, car service, taxi, restaurant etc...I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western St. Germain in late August. We chose this hotel after endless hours of research and we were definitely not disappointed. This hotel was in a perfect location, beautifully decorated and we had a spacious triple room that looked onto a lovely courtyard. The staff was very nice and we had a very charming hostess in the breakfast room. We had a wonderful breakfast each morning with a selection of cereals, yoghurt, cheeses and a delicious basket of french pastries!! The atmosphere of the hotel was very warm and friendly and there was a very nice salon off the lobby where you could sit and relax or visit with other guests. The hotel was very charming in every way from the decor to the rose scented pillow on my bed each night. The hotel is close to many attractions. Easy walking distance to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and nearby metro. Tons of cafes and great shopping surrounding the hotel as well. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: raphaekg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Premier Left Bank after a very long flight from NY and had to leave the next afternoon to catch a connecting flight to elsewhere in Europe. Hoping for a quick "taste of Paris" we booked here. It was an excellent choice. The front desk was very warm and accommodating and helped us to find a restaurant that suited our dietary needs at a very late hour. We were actually supposed to have a room that slept 4, but it was not available -- we were given two rooms and it suited us just fine. The rooms were small ("cozy") but had a great deal of character and were well-equipped. The location was excellent. My teenage son left his wallet in the room by accident, and the staff was very helpful in seeing that it was promptly shipped home (credit cards and cash untouched).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: dwbadvibe
Reviews.Content: Spent our wedding anniversary here in Spring. Reception staff proffered some useful travel advice without prompting and didn't laugh at my French! Dining staff were very friendly. Doesn't look imposing from the street and it may be small with few facilities but if you don't want to pay for things you won't use, want some original features, like to feel at home and not to be bothered this is the place. Ask yourself why you're in Paris anyway? Notre Dame, Louvre, boulevard cafes almost on the doorstep, a block from Odeon metro if you want togo further (Montmatre for example) and Batobus for the tower. Some quaint little courtyards literally round the corner, too, if you're prepared to be nosy. Our room was big for Paris, too, but it was a peculiar shape in a corner wrapping a lightwell. if you like exploring cities get "Walks in Paris"

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: susanwestofBoston
Reviews.Content: We had a great view of rooftops and Notre Dame form our 6th floor, geranium studded window.. Room was small but very comfortable. Folks at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was in a cute lower level room with fresh croissants and other wonderful breads, a nice variety of French cheeses, yogurt, cereal, hard boiled eggs, (would have loved fresh to canned fruit), and a piping pot of cafe au lait. Only complaint was that there were not adequate places for our 2 small suitcases and they ended up on the floor. Suitcase racks or a better level shelf in the closet would have been helpful. The location was fantastique! We walked to almost everything and were near two metro stops. Would stay again next time and recommend it to firends.

Reviews.Title: “excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: estravel
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here the middle of July. How grateful were we for the wonderful air-conditioning! We booked one of the larger rooms facing the courtyard. The room was very clean with alot of storage space. The bathroom was modern- a wonderful shower and counter space. Breakfast included was in a delightful room. Cold buffet with juice, fruit, cereal and assorted pastry basket. Eggs could be had for a slight charge. This hotel is in a wonderful location. Easy to walk everywhere or take the Metro. Many, many wonderful restaurants, shops, & bakeries right around the corner. The restaurant next door -La Procope- is excellent and has a long history with Paris. We found the staff friendly and helpful. We would return here.

Reviews.Title: “A 'must stay" hotel in the heart of the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: FrederickH
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in a triple room. Hotel is charming, room was very clean and extremely quiet. Room had good air conditioning and it was comfortable. Location can not be beat. Very, very close to all major attractions. Neighborhood is loaded with restaurants, cafes, patiserries and shopping. Only a half block to the Odeon metro stop and a couple of block walk to the Latin Quater. The staff was very helpful and I would absolutely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Urszula
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 3 nights in April and I really liked it. It's in a great loaction and although it's located on a very busy street we could hear no noise! Our room was nice and clean however it was a little bit smaller then we expected. It looks like we have met the same receptionist as the previous reviewer. She wasn't nice at all. During our stay she was on the phone all the time and looked very annoyed whenever we wanted to ask her something. But to be honest she was the only unfriendly person in the hotel. There was another guy at the reception in the evenings and he was great. Very, very nice, helpfull and friendly. Two ladies that served breakfast were very nice as well. The only other thing we didn't like is that we had to pay for internet even if we wanted to use wireless. Generaly speaking, despite the internet and one lady at the reception we really liked the hotel and we do recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay .....”
Reviews.Author: Pennypenny
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights here based on the TA reviews. Location was excellent, walking distance to Notre Dame and lots of restaurants. Also close to Metro station. Had a family room of 4 single beds. A little cramped but clean. Breakfast was good. However, going on past reviewers comments, we must have been there when all these lovely staff members were on holidays! On arrival, after the receptionist finally looked up from what she was doing to deal with us, we were told that our room would be half an hour, which was no problem, except that that was the end of the conversation. She did not ask us to please take a seat, or would we like a tea/coffee, we were basically just left standing there. We were offered no information about breakfast, the hotel itself or anything about the surrounding area. We had to ask about everything - I know that sounds petty, but I really felt like she was completely disinterested in even talking to us. There was however, one lady housekeeper who was very nice. Apart from this lady, I would say that it was one of the most unfriendly establishments I have ever stayed in. While technically the staff did their jobs, I didn't find them particularly nice. In short I would not stay there again nor recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints.................”
Reviews.Author: amq
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer has said it all. This is a really nice hotel in a perfect location. We paid 150 euros a night (staying two nights); the room was a little small, but perfectly adequate. No problem with the lift! We would have stayed longer, but the hotel was full. This is a three-star hotel, and you are paying a bit extra for the "touch of class", but it is worth it. As mentioned by the other reviewer, the soundproofing when the windows are closed is incredible. No television or coffee-making facility in room (probably not space for them), but they are not needed anyway. We moved to a two-star hotel in the next street which had larger rooms, and free internet access, which was 100 euros a night, and impossible to fault in any way, but without the "touch of class". Take your pick.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Romantic, Good Value, Location Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SarahApples
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a romantic weekend with my husband at the Hotel Left Bank St Germain ( Best Western) on Rue Ancienne Comedie. What a perfect location. My husband hadn't been before so we went to all the major sites - and how easy it was - minutes from the Seine, Notre Dame and the Louvre. Stepping out from the hotel we were surrounded by great restaurants & cafes. Lovely night life and Boulevard St Germain runs along the top of the street - perfect! The hotel itself is charming and the staff so very helpful. Booking river dinner cruises for us ( highly recommend doing this - so romantic and wonderful way to see the city lit up at night whilst eating fabulous food! ) Booking us taxis, and arranging shuttle services to and from Charles de Gaulle airport. We stayed in room 605 on the 6th floor - a view of Notre Dame, overlooking a tiny internal courtyard and the city scape of Paris. SO quiet even in busy times no noise. Good room, good size for Paris too! Lovely marble bathroom and even a flat screen tv. Would definately return to the hotel Left Bank St Germain, the area is the perfect area to explore Paris from and the atmosphere surrounding the hotel felt more like Parisians haunts than tourists . Hope this helps whoever reads this!
